loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
La Sra. Clementina tiene 62 años y quedo viuda hace diez años, tiene tres hijos mayores Rossana, quien es Docente, Marlene es Abogada y Jimmy cursando actualmente el último año D. la carrera D. Derecho. 
Anteriormente poseían una despensa en su domicilio que no pudo mantener cuando quedo viuda, con los años y con los préstamos D. la fundación se dedico a la venta D. joyas. Comenta que tiene ya varios clientes que siempre compran D. ella las joyas que venD., por lo que le gustaría poder tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. joyas D. plata, con lo cual podrá aumentar la variedad que tiene y D. esa forma podrá atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
Clementina, 62, was widowed ten years ago.  She has three adult children: Rossana who is a Teacher, Marlene who is an Attorney and Jimmy who is currently in the last year of Law school.

They used to have a home-based grocery store but when she was widowed she was unable to keep it.  With the passage of the years and with loans from the Fundación she went into jewelry sales.  She comments that she has several customers who always buy the jewelry she sells from her so she’d like to have more variety available to offer her customers.

She asks for the loan to buy silver jewelry to increase the variety she has on hand in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy all sorts of silver jewelry for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy is married with one child. She is 32 years-old. She raises ducks and also does rice farming. She has been raising ducks and farming for 10 years now. This is the first loan that she got from Kiva partner VisionFund. She requested a loan to buy duck feed and fertilizers for her rice paddy. With this loan, she hopes to feed her ducks to be healthy and fat to earn more for her family in order to have some savings and also to keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy duck feed and fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La sra. Maria tiene 33 años  y está casada con el sr. Juan de 38 años. Tienen 3 hijos, dos varones, uno de 13, otro de 10 años y  una niña de 6 años respectivamente, todos se encuentran cursando sus estudios primarios.
El sr. Juan, su marido, es funcionario Público, por lo que ambos ayudan con los gastos de la casa. La sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de comestibles desde el año 2009. Dichos comestibles son  empanadas de distintos tipos, helados y gaseosas de distintas medidas.
La misma desea invertir el préstamo solicitado para la compra de Helados de distintos sabores en forma mayorista ya que  obtendría a un menor precio de compra y lo cual aumentaría sus ganancias por las ventas que realiza.
texts.en:
María, 33, is married to Juan, 38; they have three children, two boys who are 13 and 10 years old and a 6-year-old daughter.  They are all going to elementary school.

Juan, her husband, is a public official so they both contribute to household expenses.  María has been selling food since 2009.  She sells such things as various types of turnovers, frozen treats and soft-drinks in assorted sizes.

She wants to invest the requested loan in the purchase of frozen treats in assorted flavors at wholesale because she’ll get a lower purchase price that way and her profits on sales will increase.

loans.use: to buy frozen treats.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is married with six children and all go to school. She has one additional family member.

She sells charcoal on a wholesale basis at the market. She has been in this business for the last five years. Her other source of income is from rental houses. She works six days a week .She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO in order to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to assist in the transportation of charcoal and also to build more commercial houses. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. She lives  in her own house and  the  family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Aligismat

texts.en: Aligismat is a teacher of physical education and his wife is a retired teacher of the Russian language. He is 54 years old, and lives with his wife and grandson. Aligismat's business is raising sheep. He sells them at the bazaar. He’s asking for 1,500 Azerbaijani manats to invest in farming. He will buy feed and hay. The loan will be very useful for his business.

loans.use: to maintain the business.

loans.name: Natalicio De Jesus

texts.es:
El Sr. Natalicio es de Ciudad del Este, está casado con la Sra. Florencia, tienen 4 hijos menores. Natalicio se dedica a la venta  de harina de maíz, que el mismo fabrica con su esposa Florencia.
Se inicio en esta actividad vendiendo productos que fabricaba un vecino, junto un poco de dinero y compro para su máquina de moler maíz, para que de esa forma pueda trabajar en forma independiente con su familia.
El ha demostrado responsabilidad en créditos anteriores que vine  pagando en forma excelente, por lo que esta vez solicita de nuevo la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de Kiva para la compra de maíz, el cual es el producto indispensable para su negocio.
Natalicio agradece a las personas que confían en él para que el pueda acceder a créditos ya que manifiesta que es la única manera de obtener un capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Natalicio is from Ciudad del Este.  He’s married to Florencia and they have four minor children.  Natalicio sells corn flour that he himself makes with his wife, Florencia.

He started this activity selling products that a neighbor made.  He saved up a bit of money and bought his own machine to grind corn so that he could work independently with his family.

He has shown responsibility with his previous loans that he’s been repaying in excellent form so he’s asking Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for a new loan to buy corn which is an indispensable product for his business.

Natalicio thanks the people who trust him so that he can access loans because he states that this is the only way he can obtain working capital.

loans.use: to buy corn to make corn flour.

loans.name: Jedida

texts.en:
Jedida is 35 years-old and single.  She has one child who is 13 years-old. She operates a green grocer and has been in the business for the past five years. She gets a monthly income of KES 30,000 from the business.

This is her forth loan term from Kiva partner KADET LTD.  She paid her previous loans successfully.  She will use the loan amount to buy vegetables ,tomatoes and onions in large quantities in order to stock her business.

She will use the anticipated profit to educate her child. Her dream is to own a retail shop and have a stable income in order to raise her child.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes, and onions from farmers to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La Sra Julia tiene 74 años, vive en la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso,  tiene una Despensa en su casa. El trabajo que realiza lo ha hecho por  más D. 5 años, desD. que vino D. Ciudad del Este, vendió todo lo que tenia allá y vino, se instaló y compro una casa.
Uno D. sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen la carrera universitaria para poder ser profesionales y que D. esa forma por medio D. sus estudios ellos tengan un mejor porvenir y que no pasen por privaciones como las que ella tuvo que atravesar.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra D. Bebidas, como ser cervezas, vinos y gaseosa con lo cual podrá abastecer su despensa y agradece a la Fundación por darle la oportunidad D. acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Julia, 74, lives in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso; she has a home-based grocery store.  She has been doing this work for over five years since she moved here from Ciudad del Este.  She sold everything she owned there and moved here, settled in and bought a house.

One of her dreams is that her children complete university careers so that they can be professionals and through their studies attain better futures and not have to suffer the privations she had to undergo.

She is asking for the loan to buy beverages like beer, wine and soft-drinks to stock her store and she thanks the Fundación for giving her the opportunity to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine and soft-drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Baryor

texts.en: Baryor is 27 years-old and lives in Jacob Town.  She is married and has four children aged 4 to 15, and they are currently in school and live at home. For three years she has been operating a cook shop (Restaurant) in the local market.  She makes lots of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper and oil for her business and she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper and oil for her business,

loans.name: Nonvigbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NONVIGBE est composé de trois membres qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Anne Marie, est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Anne Marie est mariée à un fonctionnaire nommé Donatien et est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés dont un reste à sa charge. Anne Marie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Anne Marie n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Anne Marie mène comme activité depuis sept ans environs, la vente de bouillie de maïs, accompagnée de beignets (faits à base de la farine de blé) dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Anne Marie achète des fruits qu'elle vend dans son quartier. Anne Marie s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Anne Marie et son groupe sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The NONVIGBE group consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group named Anne Marie is the one with her hand raised in the picture. To raise the level of their business and better meet the demand of their customers, this group is seeking for the second time the financial support of ALIDé.

Anne Marie is married to Donatien, a public servant. She is the mother of three children all attending (or having attended) school, and of whom one remains under her care. She lives together with her children and her husband.

Anne Marie has never been to school. To support herself and her children over the past seven years, her business activity has been to sell corn mush along with donuts (made ​​from wheat flour) in her neighborhood. As an additional activity, Anne Marie buys and sells fruit in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies in Benin.

In order to strengthen their business and better serve their customers, Anne Marie and her group are seeking a credit loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to increase the level of their business activity.

loans.use: Buy corn, wheat flour, vegetable oil and fruit.

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es:
La señora Zunilda tiene 37 años D. edad, está casada hace 20 años con el señor Santiago D. 42 años D. edad,  tienen tres hijos D. 20, 12 y 3 años respectivamente, la mayor está cursando el primer año D. Contabilidad en la universidad,  el otro está en el séptimo grado, y el menor D. todos aun no va a la escuela.
La sra. Zunilda tiene una despensa,  se dedica a este negocio desD. hace 4 años gracias a un capital que le había dado su marido que es empleado. Ambos, por medio D. sus ingresos ayudan en la casa. La idea D. la pareja es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, y puedan terminar una carrera universitaria y que pueda cada uno contar con una profesión que le permita salir adelante en la vida. Solicita este préstamo para la compra D. productos para su negocio como ser arroz, fideos, azúcar, gaseosas, galletas, tomate, cebollas y otros artículos que le permitirá aumentar su stock y D. esa forma poder mejorar su ingreso mensual.
texts.en:
Zunilda, 37, has been married to Santiago, 42, for 20 years; they have three children who are 20, 12 and 3 years old respectively.  The oldest is in first year of Accounting in the university, the next one is in 7th graD. and the youngest still hasn’t started going to school.

Zunilda has a grocery store, a business she’s had for four years thanks to capital her husband, who is employed, gave her.  Both of them help support the household with their income.  The couple’s plan is that their children continue with their studies so that they can complete university careers so that they can count on having professions that will allow them to get ahead in life.

She’s asking for this loan to buy stock merchandise for her store like: noodles, rice, sugar, soft-drinks, cookies, tomatoes, onions and other items that will allow her to increase her stock to earn better monthly income.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child, and the child doesn’t go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, rice, maize flour and beef. Her aspirations and goals are to own a fully stocked restaurant. Her major business challenges are defaulters and transportation. She lives in a rented house, and the  family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, rice, maize flour and beef.

loans.name: Ayoob

texts.en: Ayoob is a 24-year-old single man from Gaza. He owns his own barber shop. He hopes that through this loan, he would be able to buy machines for cutting hair and beauty products. And once he gets this loan, he would be able to expand his business since he will have everything he needs and it will be complete.

loans.use: buy machines for cutting hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 27 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has four children between two and 7 years old. All of her children are currently in school and live at home. For twelve years she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in the community market. She now makes a larger profit and has more customers than before, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, coal and oil for her business. She hopes to change her business to a bar and restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, coal and oil for her business

loans.name: Le Bienfait Group

texts.fr:
Mme BIBATA est la représentante du groupe LE BIENFAIT .Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 26ans et le moins âgé a 15an. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Elle est gérante d’un restaurant (vend de la soupe de boilleau etc.) et vend des jus et de la glace depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne à l’abattoir de Ouagadougou et au yaar de Gounghin. Elle s’approvisionne par jour. Ses clients sont les femmes et les  hommes.

Elle veut  s’acheter une charrette de bois de chauffe, 30kg de viande pour la soupe et 30 miches de pain qu’elle vend avec la soupe.

Mme  économise pour agrandir son hangar. Elle ambitionne ouvrir d’autres points de vente pour sa restauration et continuer à assurer la scolarité de  ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bibata is the representative of the group LE BIENFAIT. She is married with six children, the oldest of whom is 26 years old and the youngest 15. Two of the children go to school. She has four people under her care.

She manages a restaurant (selling meat-based soup, etc.). She also has been selling juices and ice for 10 years. She buys daily from the slaughterhouse in Ouagadougou and at the Gounghin yaar (market). Her customers are both women and men.

She wants to buy a cartload of firewood, 30 kg of meat for the soup and 30 loaves of bread she sells with the soup.

Mrs. Bibata is saving to expand her premises. She aims to open more outlets for her restaurant business and continue to provide schooling for her children.

loans.use: buy a cartload of firewood, 30 kg of meat for the soup and 30 loaves of bread to be sold with the soup.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
El señor Vidal tiene 47 años de edad, está casado con la señora Nancy de 43 años edad, en su matrimonio tuvieron 2 hijos, ellos viven en la ciudad de Itá.
El señor Vidal se dedica a la confección de guantes de todo tipo de materiales;  el mismo se siente muy orgulloso por la profesión a la que se dedica, ya que gracias a eso pudo criar a sus hijos, hacerlos una familia  muy respetada y admirada por toda su comunidad.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de los elementos esenciales para la fabricación de los guantes, como ser cueros, cuerinas, hilos, moldes y otros. Desea poder seguir creciendo con su negocio, para que pueda seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Vidal, 47, is married to Nancy, 43, and they had two children; they live in the city of Itá.  Vidal manufactures gloves in all kinds of materials.  He feels very proud of the profession he’s engaged in because thanks to it he was able to raise his children and form a family that’s very respected and admired in his community.

He asks for the loan to buy the essential elements to make the gloves like leather, faux leather, thread, patterns and others.  He wants to continue growing with his business so that he can continue to help his family.

loans.use: to buy leather, faux leather, patterns, thread and others for glove manufacturing.

loans.name: Hayfa

texts.en:
Hayfa is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of three children.  She and her husband work together to raise and educate them.

Hayfa started selling mobile phones from her house to friends, neighbors and relatives in the year 2000. Her business has grown well and now she has many foreigners who visit her to buy used or new mobile phones. Her good communication skills have helped her a lot to expand her business. 

Hayfa has been through 10 consecutive loan cycles with Kiva field partner Al Majmoua. Her previous loans helped her a lot to expand her business, improve her family's living standards, and to afford special maintenance for her house. She made her house an ideal healthy living house.

Hayfa is a borrower in good standing who works hard to improve her business.  She plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy new models of mobile phones to sell.  She hopes to open a mobile services shop in the future and start other businesses for her children to manage.

loans.use: to buy new models of mobile phones

loans.name: Esse Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ESSE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Roselyne Larissa est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Roselyne Larissa est âgée de 27 ans et vit au Bénin. Roselyne Larissa est mariée à un militaire du nom de Franck. Le couple a un enfant qui vit avec eux. Roselyne Larissa et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Roselyne Larissa a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Roselyne Larissa vend depuis cinq ans des tissus et des glacières de façon ambulante. Roselyne Larissa s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Roselyne Larissa sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ESSE, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
The ESSE group is composed of three persons who reside in the same neighborhood. This is the second time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé, to raise the level of its business activity. The representative of the group, Roselyne Larissa, is the one raising her hand in the picture.

Roselyne Larissa is 27 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a soldier named Frank. The couple has one child living with them. She and her husband share responsibility for household duties.

Roselyne Larissa stopped attending school when in high school. To meet her needs and those of her child, she has been an itinerant merchant of fabrics and coolers for the past five years. She gets her supplies in Benin.

In the quest for customer satisfaction and to increase her income and turnover, Roselyne Larissa (together with the other members of ESSE) is requesting a second credit loan.

loans.use: Buy fabrics and coolers.

loans.name: Cristhian Herminio

texts.es:
Cristhian tiene 18 años, es soltero y sin hijos, es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, vive en casa propia con su madre la Sra. Bacilica.
El joven Cristhian se dedica a la venta ambulante de termos, parrillas y otros, hace más de 4 años, ya que casi toda su familia trabaja en este mismo ramo y con el obtienen muy buen ingreso mensual aparte de que ya cuenta con una clientela y varias zonas de trabajo. 
El solicita el crédito para la compra de termos, parrillas y otros artículos, los cuales le servirán para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes y a la vez atraer a más. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Cristhian, 18, is single and has no children.  He’s from the city of Paraguarí and lives in his own house with his mother, Bacilica.  He is vendor of thermos bottles, grills and other items.  He’s been in business for over four years since almost his entire family is involved in this same line of work and they earn good monthly income.  Besides, he already has a well-established clientele and several work zones.

He is asking for the loan to buy thermos bottles, grills and other items to meet customer demand and to attract more customers.  He thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it gives him because getting the loan will be of great help to him.

loans.use: to buy thermos bottles, grills and other items for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Matilde Simplicia (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un comptable du nom de Nicolas. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Matilde Simplicia vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Matilde Simplicia n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis cinq ans, Matilde Simplicia vend des savons et des conserves dans son quartier. Matilde Simplicia achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Matilde Simplicia et les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: Gbenonkpo is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Matilde Simplicia (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 37 years old and married to an accountant by the name of Nicolas. The couple has three children, all at school and in their care. Matilde Simplicia lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the various family expenses between them. Matilde Simplicia did not go to school and for the past five years she has been selling soaps and canned foods in her neighborhood. She buys her products in Benin. This is the second time that Matilde Simplicia and the other members of the Gbenonkpo group have requested financial aid from Alidé with the aim of strengthening their working capital and business in order to respond better to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy cartons of soaps and canned foods.

loans.name: Olga Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señorita Olga tiene 19 años de edad, es una joven muy emprendedora, estudiante, soltera y sin hijos. Cuenta con un pequeño comedor en el centro de la ciudad, muy acudido.
Según comenta Olga es muy concurrido su local por las exquisitas minutas y variedades de menú para almuerzos, como guisos, tallarines, estofados, asado a la olla, minutas como empanadas, milanesas y otros. Empezó gracias a la ayuda de un hermano y su madre, una de sus hermanas colabora con ella en las tareas de todo el día.
Solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y kiva para la compra de una heladera ya que solo cuenta con un pequeño congelador, y desea surtir más la venta de bebidas.
texts.en:
Olga, 19, is a very enterprising young woman; she’s a student, single and has no children.  She has a very popular, small snack bar located downtown.  According to Olga, it’s very popular because of the exquisite snacks and the varied lunch menu like stir fried dishes, pasta, stews, pot roast and snacks like turnovers, breaded steaks and others.  She started thanks to a brother and to her mother and one of her sisters helps her out with the chores all day.

She is asking for help from Fundación Paraguaya and from Kiva to buy a cooler since she only has a small freezer and she’d like to stock more beverages to sell.

loans.use: to buy a cooler for the snack bar.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 51 years old and married to George. Together they have four children ages 18, 23, 26, and 28 years old. She is a farmer and sells second hand clothes. She has been in the business for the past 10 years. She gets a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This is her third loan term in KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for farming and also purchase some clothes for resale.


She will use the anticipated profit to purchase a dairy cow. Her dream is to own a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
Agua Viva se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, el cual trabaja con la fundación desde julio de 2011, son  15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando ya en el cuarto ciclo, en forma coordinada y de mutua ayuda en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Una de las señoras es Maria, ella se dedica a la venta de joyas en plata, comenta que gracias a su amabilidad y habilidad para las ventas ha logrado formarse una clientela bien definida. Por medio de este trabajo ella ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y a su hogar. Ya que le va muy bien quiere seguir con dicho negocio y por lo mismo solicita el crédito, para que mediante el pueda comprar más variedad de joyas, para que de esa forma pueda atraer a más clientes.
Ella al igual que sus amigas del comité, está muy contenta por la oportunidad que Kiva y la fundación les da.
texts.en:
“Agua Viva” is the name of this excellent group of women from the city of Itá which has been working with the Fundación since July, 2011.  It’s a group of 15 women who are working in their fourth cycle already in a coordinated, mutually supportive fashion in the Fundación’s enterprising women program.

One of the women is María who sells silver jewelry.  She comments that thanks to her kindness and sales abilities she’s attained a well-defined clientele.  Through this work she’s been able to support her family and her household.  

Since she’s doing so well, she’d like to continue with the business so is asking for a loan to buy a larger variety of jewelry so that she can attract more customers this way.  She, as well as her other group members, is very happy for the opportunity Kiva and the Fundación gives them.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Yeyimin Group

texts.fr: YEYIMIN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Martine Yabo (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans. Martine Yabo est mariée à un certain Ramanou. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Martine Yabo vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Martine Yabo a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Martine Yabo vend depuis cinq ans, divers produits (riz, savons, conserves, huile végétale) dans son quartier. Martine Yabo s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Martine Yabo sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe YEYIMIN. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Yeyimin is a group of three people who all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group, Martine Yabo (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 38 years old and married to a man called Ramanou. The couple has two children, both at school and in their care. Martine Yabo lives with her husband and children. The couple covers the various household expenses between them. Martine Yabo left school at primary level. In order to provide for their various expenses, she has been selling a variety of products (rice, soaps, canned foods, vegetable oil) in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand, increasing her working capital and strengthening her business, Martine Yabo is requesting a loan from Alidé with the other members of the Yeyimin group. This loan will allow them to respond better to customer demand and to make more money.

loans.use: to buy various products (sacks of rice, soaps, canned foods and vegetable oil).

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
A. is a 30-year-old married man and the father of one child. A. has worked in painting cars and vehicles since 11 years ago. This long experience has gained A. his customers' trust and confidence.

A. is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in  order to buy new machines and tools necessary to improve his work.

A. is a man with a good reputation; he sacrifices his life for the sake of his family's living.

He hopes he can make a bigger family and expand his business as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy new, improved tools for his business.

loans.name: Fawziah

texts.en:
Fawziah is 43 years old and a mother of eight sons and daughter. She is married to Izzat who has a car repair workshop where he changes wheels and sells special car oil.

After he retired from the military, he opened his workshop to be able to support his big family. Fawziah wants to help her husband to make more income in the workshop so she decided to apply for this loan and buy more high quality car oil that is required for the new model cars. Because Fawziah is a conservative person, she preferred that her husband Izzat appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more high quality car oil for her husband's auto repair shop

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 55-year-old man; he is married with three sons and four daughters. He is a taxi driver and one of his sons is a worker with a decent salary. Mohammad wants to make some repairs to his house, such as painting and changing tiles. He also wants to purchase some new home furniture, such as living room furniture and bedroom furniture for his children. But the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for these items, so he needs a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Mohammad gets the loan, he will be able to pay for the necessary repairs to his house and pay to purchase new home furniture. This will enable him to offer better living conditions for his family. Mohammad is photographed in a FATEN branch office.

loans.use: to repair his house and purchase some new home furniture.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 58-year-old woman who raised three sons. Two of her sons are married and have started their own families. She is still living with her husband and her unmarried son. Each of them has his own job. To fill her free time, Fatmeh opened, with the help of her husband, a small food store in their neighborhood. She sells kids' snacks, sugar, salt, canned goods, etc.

Now Fatmeh wants to add more items, like chocolate, tofu and other to her store so she can be prepared for the upcoming holiday season.

loans.use: To buy more items like chocolate and tofu to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 53 years old and married to Harrison. Together they have six children, aged 30, 28, 26, 22 and 18 years old. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 13 years. She gets a monthly income of 84,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the farming businesses.

This is her third loan term with KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase a chaff cutter for help in feeding her dairy cattle.

With the anticipated profit, she will purchase a piece of land to expand her mixed farming. Her dream is to add more dairy cattle on her farm and raise her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha is a 57-year-old housewife. She has been sewing bed covers and some clothes for the last 10 years at her house. Recently she started sewing curtains and other types of covers and sheets, depending on what her customer wants. But sometimes she faces a few troubles when sewing because of her old machine. So now she has applied for a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine to help her overcome the difficulties she had using the old one.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Magdalene. She is a widow and has five children, aged 22, 18, 14, 10 and 7 years. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they help her with her business and they are her relatives. In 2009, Magdalene established her patient drugs business. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 950,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Magdalene has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy essential patient drugs for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Magdalene plans to build a dwelling and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for additional essential patient drugs.

loans.name: Las Residentas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Residentas” es un comité D. 10 mujeres D. excelente estructura, unidas, diligentes y fraternales entre ellas. Estas señoras son D. la ciudad D. Villarrica, todas son vecinas y amigas. Se reúnen quincenalmente para brindarse apoyo y ayuda las unas a las otras en su afán D. mejorar sus situación económica. 
Una D. las integrantes es la señora Emilia es modista, oficio que le permite sacar adelante a toda su familia. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre le traen trabajo para hacer, lo cual a ella le conviene, pues le trae muy buenos ingresos. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas, hilos, encajes y otros, los cuales son los insumos indispensables para su taller. Ella al igual que su comité está muy contenta con la ayuda D. la fundación y D. kiva.
texts.en:
The “Las Residentas” group is a well-structured, diligent, unified and sisterly committee of 10 women from the city of Villarrica; they are all neighbors and friends.  They meet every two weeks to proviD. support for each other in their struggle to improve their economic situation.

One of the group members is Emilia.  She’s a dressmaker, an occupation that allows her to support her entire family.  She comments that she has many customers that always bring her work to do which suits her interests because it means good income for her.

She requests the loan to buy fabric, thread, lace and others which are the indispensable supplies for her workshop.  She, as well as her committee, is very happy for the help from the Fundación and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, lace and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock of maize cereal for sale.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor is a 28 year old, married man from Gaza. Noor owns a supermarket in Gaza. He hopes that, through this loan, he would be able to expand the size of the store and improve it. He believes that this will help him live a better life, financially.

loans.use: to expand the size of the store and improve it

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten sheep and food for livestock.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El comité San Juan tiene 11 integrantes, todas ellas amigas y vecinas D. la ciudad D. curuguaty. Ellas se unieron con el propósito D. generar un bien para todas ellas, ya que desean progresar en sus emprendimientos y piensan que la fundación les ayudará mucho.
La señora Matías es una D. las integrantes, ella tiene una despensa, la cual está bien surtida, por este motivo es que siempre tiene buena cantidad D. clientes. Ella comenta que este es su principal medio D. subsistencia por lo que le gustaría poder seguir invirtiendo en el.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra D. enlatados, azúcar, yerba, fideos y demás con lo que podrá abastecer su local. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda.
texts.en:
The “San Juan” committee has 11 members who are all friends and neighbors from the city of Curuguaty.  They joined together in order to generate wellbeing for all of them because they hope to make progress in their enterprises and they think the Fundación will help them much.

Matías is one of the group members; she has a grocery store that’s well stocked and because of this she always has a good number of customers.  She comments that this is her main means of support so she’d like to be able to continue investing in it.

She asks for the loan to buy canned goods, sugar, herbs, pasta and others to stock her store.  She thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the help.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sugar, herbs, noodles and others.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana sells smoked fish in Takoradi. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. Juliana has been selling fish for four years. Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 49 years old and is married with 4 children aged 16, 14, 8 and 5. He has 2 additional dependents living with him. They are his wife's relatives. 
In 2004, Mohamed established his plumbing fittings business. He began his business by repairing fittings whilst he was an apprentice at SALWACO. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from his business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy plumbing material for his shop. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. 
In the future, Mohamed plans to do contract for major companies in order to cater to his children's schooling and medication. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy plumbing material for his business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes sells fried fish in Takoradi. She has five children. Her husband is a security man. She has been frying fish for sale for ten years now. As part of her responsibilities she pays utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy fish to fry for sale. She hopes to reinvest the additional income she will earn as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en: Khitam, a 40-year-old hardworking woman, takes care of some of the working moms’ children for a few hours during the day. Khitam also has 14 sheep and she sells its’ fresh milk and sometimes makes butter, yogurt and cheese out of it. Now Khitam has applied for this loan to buy food for the sheep, and to buy some equipment that would help her make more milk products to increase her profit. Because Khitam is a conservative person, she asked her husband Mohammad to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy food for the sheep she has

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita has 4 children with her husband, who is a driver by profession. She sells cooked rice and also sells provisions at Takoradi. Rita’s income is used to help pay the school fees of the children. Rita will use the loan to obtain rice and provisions to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rita plans to stock the provision shop.

loans.use: to obtain rice and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret fries fish at Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana. She is divorced, and currently taking care of 5 children. She has been in this trade for 6 years. She is responsible for educating, feeding and providing shelter for the children. Her loan will be used to procure fresh fish to fry for resale.

loans.use: to procure fresh fish to fry for resale.

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó con 15 mujeres de ciudad del Este, están en el primer ciclo. Ellas desean que por medio del comité puedan ayudar a sus familias e hijos, dándoles una vida digna y decorosa, sin privaciones.
Bernardina, la presidenta del grupo, se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, con lo cual genera los ingresos para mantenerse y mantener a su familia. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que no tiene miedo a realizar cualquier tipo de trabajo. Comenta que todo su esfuerzo es siempre encaminado a su familia, ya que quiere ayudarlos en todo lo que ella pueda.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropa interior, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes y a la vez atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed with 15 women from Ciudad del Este who are in their first cycle.  They want through the committee to be able to help their families and children providing them with proper, decent, privation-free lives.

Bernardina is group President.  She sells underwear which generates income to support herself and her family.  She defines herself as a very hardworking, enterprising woman who is not afraid of doing any kind of work.  She comments that all her effort is to always keep her family on the right path because she wants to help them with everything she can.

She is asking for the loan to buy underwear to stock up and meet customer demand while attracting more customers at the same time.

loans.use: to buy underwear for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Uganda. She is married and has 4 children. All her children are in school. Florence lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and electricity bills.
Florence has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 5 years. She works 7 days a week. Florence sells her products at a market, by means of wholesale and retail. She also generates additional income by selling second hand clothes. The main business challenges for Florence include transportation and seasonality. Her business goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to own a delivery van in order to minimize transportation costs. 
Florence has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the funds to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié père de cinq en fants.Il tient une boutique de vente de denrées alimentaires en face de la route nationale qui traverse sa localité.Les revenus générés par sa boutique lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et ceux de sa famille.Il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter du riz, de l'huile, du sucre et diverses denrées alimentaires.Son ambition est de devenir grossiste.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man and father of five children. He runs a small shop selling foodstuffs opposite the main road that runs through his locality. The income generated by his shop enables him to cover his personal expenses and those of his family. He requests a loan of 500000f to purchase rice, oil, sugar and various foodstuffs. His ambition is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar and various foodstuffs.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is a mother of three sons and one daughter, all under the age of 20. She is a 40-year-old housewife who started a small retail business four years ago to help her husband who works as a taxi driver. Manal basically buys clothes, blankets, and shoes at a wholesale price and re-sells it at a reasonable price. This brought her a lot of customers and made her business grow through the last four years. In order for her to widen her business and reach out to the clothes shops and be their provider, she is thinking of buying a distribution bus that could help her achieve her goal. That’s why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a distribution bus

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a farmer. She buys maize and rice in bags (her hand is placed on the bags of maize) and retails them in smaller quantities for sale at Takoradi, which she has done for 10 years. Faustina will use the loan to purchase rice and maize to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans buy a shop.

loans.use: to purchase rice and maize to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is divorced and has four children. She sells provisions and is also a hair dresser in Takoradi, which she has done for three years. She wishes to buy hair products to stock her shop so that she can use them on her customers' hair. The loan she is hoping to receive will be used to procure these hair products.

loans.use: to procure hair products.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is married and has two children. She has received a junior high school education. Esther sells food stuffs (as shown in the picture above) in Takoradi and has done so for five years. Her husband is a farmer. Esther supports her husband to provide the basic needs of the home. Esther will use the loan to purchase food stuffs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa sells items such as cooking oil, canned tomatoes, garden eggs, spaghetti, and more in Takoradi. Theresa has received a junior high school level of education. She is married and has one child. Theresa has been selling food items for five years. She helps her spouse to pay the household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy food items to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 36-year-old young woman. She is married with four sons and two daughters, Her husband is a worker with a decent salary. Dalal wants to finish her house by painting, installing tiles, installing windows and doors, etc, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for it. She needs to take a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. When Dalal gets the loan, she will be able to pay for these expenses and complete finishing her house. This loan will enable her to live with her family under better home conditions. Dalal is a conservative woman, so her husband Waleed is photographed instead.

loans.use: to pay for finishing her house.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells cosmetics, pegs and cloth in Takoradi. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a teacher. Rose has been selling cosmetics for five years. She supports her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy cosmetics. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa sells cosmetics, plastic containers, slippers and clothing in Takoradi. She is a widow taking care of two children. She has been in this trade for four years. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetics, slippers and plastic containers for resale. She anticipates building a better shop with the new profit she hopes to earn.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, slippers and plastic containers for resale.

loans.name: Shallot

texts.en: Shallot is standing close to a table on which she has displayed food items for resale. She also sells used clothing in Takoradi. She is married and has three children. For the past six years the income she makes from her sales has gone to support her husband in taking care of their children. The loan is going to be used to acquire additional food items to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to acquire additional food items to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
This is 44 year old Massa. She is divorced and has five children. She has two additional dependents who live with her. They help her elder sister and assist in schooling.
In 2005, Massa established her provisions and drinks business. She started by selling drinks and then provisions. Working six days a week and ten hours a day. She earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 
She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Massa has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans. She requires this new loan in order to buy drinks and provisions, such as milk, sugar, margarine, tea, coffee etc, for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for drinks and provisions, such as milk, sugar, margarine, tea, coffee etc, for her business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 8 children, off which only 4 go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. 
She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis to all categories of people. She has been in this business for the last 6 years. She works seven days a week. She lives in her own house with her family. She has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.
She has requested a loan of 100000 from MCD and to start selling on wholesale only. Her major business challenges are ever increasing prices of charcoal and transportation.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en:
Fedaa is a 29-year-old housewife who has two sons and one daughter. It has been three years now since she started to bring in some goods and sell at her house to her friends and neighbors. Most of the goods she sells are clothes and blankets.

Since there is a holiday season that is coming in the next two months where everyone goes shopping for new clothes especially for kids, and because she already knows among her friends and neighbors who prefers to buy from her than go out for shopping in crowded places, Fedaa wants to bring in more clothes and items to be prepared for those holidays and reach her customers' expectations. That’s why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and items to sell

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El Comité " San Cayetano" está conformado por 14  mujeres que residen en la ciudad de Curuguaty, son  mujeres de escasos recursos, pero todas cuentan con una actividad fija, y se reúnen con el objetivo de adquirir el préstamo para invertir en sus respectivas actividades. Se encuentran en el Primer ciclo y están aprendiendo el valor de la comunicación y el trabajo en equipo, reciben capacitación y asesoramiento y aprenden a ahorrar para usos futuros.
Nansy, es una de las integrantes del comité, ella vende todo tipo de lencerías. Comenta que tiene clientes y clientas que siempre compran de ella, lo cual la trae muy buenos ingresos. Ella por medio de este trabajo logra mantener su hogar y también a su familia, por lo que le gustaría poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, por ello solicita el crédito para la compra de lencerías, tanto para hombres como para mujeres con lo cual podrá renovar su stock.
Ella al igual que sus compañeras está muy agradecida con la fundación y Kiva por esta oportunidad
texts.en:
The “San Cayetano” committee has 14 women members living in the city of Curuguaty.  They are women of scarce resources but they all have a steady activity.  They meet with the goal of acquiring a loan to invest in their various activities.  They are in their first cycle and are learning the value of communication and teamwork; they are receiving training and assessment and they are learning how to save for future eventualities.

Nansy is one of the group members; she sells all types of lingerie.  She comments that she has both men and women customers who buy from her which produces good income.  

Through this work she’s able to support her home and her family too so she’d like to continue investing in her business and is asking for a loan to buy lingerie for women and underwear for men to renew her stock.  She, as well as her fellow group members, is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy women's lingerie and men's underwear for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace, shown standing in front of her mini-shop, sells wakye in Takoradi. She is a widow and has five children. She has been selling wakye for 20 years. Her loan will be used to buy beans and rice to cook and then sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to buy beans and rice to cook and then sell.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a 27-year-old married woman with two school-going children. Her husband, Paul, is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Priscillah has operated a retail shop for the past three years; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge in the fluctuating prices of commodities. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase rice, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her shop. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans to boost her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase rice, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée , mère de 9 enfants .Elle mène une activité d'aviculture et fournit en poulets de chair de grandes sociétés de sa localité.Elle vend aussi des tissus et des denrées alimentaires à domicile.Elle entretient ses enfants et aide son mari avec les revenus de ses actités.Elle sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter 50 poulets de chair et des aliments.Son ambition est de renforcer son activité.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman, mother of 9 children. She has a poultry farming business and supplies broiler chickens to some of the big companies of her locality. She also sells fabrics and foodstuffs  from home. She provides for her children and helps her husband with the income from her activities. She requests a loan of 100000f to purchase 50 broiler chickens and some food. Her ambition is to build up her business.

loans.use: to buy 50 broiler chickens and some food.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina sells cooked rice in Takoradi. She is married and has three children. She has been in the cooking business for thirteen years. She is responsible for feeding, clothing and educating her children. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice and other food items to cook to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and other food items to cook to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is into palm kernel oil production in Takoradi. She is married and has six children. Her husband is an electrician. Mary has been selling kernel oil for three years. She responsibly supports her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to procure kernels to make oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards university education for her children.

loans.use: to procure kernels to make kernel oil.

loans.name: Subhiah

texts.en:
Subhiah is a 53-year-old divorced woman who started a small business a year ago to be able to support herself.

Subhiah’s business started by renting party and wedding dresses to the ladies and expanded to include doing make-up for the brides at her home.  Now she has applied for this loan to buy beauty salon basic tools and a skin cleaner machine.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon basic tools and a skin cleaner machine.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva sells food products such as fresh pepper, tomatoes, plantain, okra, garden eggs, and groundnut paste or peanut butter in Takoradi. She is married and has one child. Her husband is into sand-winning. Her loan will be used to buy more food products to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more food products to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 41-year-old married man with 2 children, one of whom is enrolled in school while the other one is too young for school. His wife Naomi is a farmer who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his child.

Daniel has operated a retail shop for the past 2 years; in addition he wants to start a new motorbike transporting business. His potential clients are the local area villagers. He faces a major challenge of competition from other retail operators around his village. He dreams of expanding his business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase a motorbike for his new transport business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance to boost his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his new transport business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 30-year-old lady who is married with two children. 

Yasmeen has established a small beauty salon in a room in her house where she works alone as a hair stylist and makeup artist. She also has a few dresses for rental to bring in more income for the family.

Now Yasmeen has applied for this loan in order to improve the beauty salon she has to be more professional by adding new equipment and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and cosmetics

loans.name: Najuwa

texts.en: Najuwa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children, only 2 of who go to school. She sells second hand clothes on a retail basis. She sells her products door to door. She has been in business for the last 3 years. She works six days a week. She has requested for a loan of 100,000 from MCDT SACCO which she is going to use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land. Her major business challenges are seasonality and ever increasing prices of clothes. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comité San Miguel se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también realizan actividades en conjunto para fomentar el compañerismo y trabajo en equipo. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades.
Juana se dedica a la cría y posterior venta de animales. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que implica un gran esfuerzo el cuidar a los animales y estar pendientes de ellos en todo sentido, pero pese a la lucha a ella le gusta mucho su trabajo. Por medio de este trabajo ella obtiene los ingresos necesarios para la manutención de su familia y para paliar los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para los animales que tiene, para que de esa forma pueda tener de reserva de reserva.
texts.en:
The “San Miguel” committee formed when several neighbors from the city of Santaní joined together.  All the group members carry out independent activities but they also carry out joint activities to build up their companionship and teamwork.  The members formed a very united group that’s quite able to carry out group activities.

Juana raises animals to sell later.  She comments that her work is very demanding because caring for animals implies great effort for she must care for them in every sense but despite the struggle, she enjoys the work very much.  

Through this work she’s able to earn income needed to support her family and cover household expenses.  She is asking for the loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for the animals she has so that she can have it in reserve.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 39-year-old mother of five daughters and one son. She is married to Khalaf who has retired from the military and started working as a bus driver. To be able to support their family, Mona started a small retail business from selling clothes at home, which grew through the last two years to include accessories. Now that Mona has gained a respected number of customers through friends and neighbors, she decided to increase the quantity she has of goods and add blankets to sell as we are knocking on winter’s doors. In the future, Mona wants to expand her business by having her own store to sell clothes, blankets, and accessories, and have a special section for home products.

loans.use: to buy clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with five children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Mwanasiti has operated a leso (kanga, or traditional African cloth) selling business for the past nine years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase more pairs of lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its favorable policies.

loans.use: To purchase more pairs of lesos (African cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 40-year-old mother of two sons and three daughters. She used to sew clothes as a service for people until recently. She started in her free time. After delivering her orders, she made teddy bears for sale.

Using her connection through her existing customers and neighbors and through her children’s connections too, she was able to sell those teddy bears, which brought her new orders for new ones.

Now Bushra has applied for this loan to buy a new sewing machine and more material and fabric to make those teddy bears and create new stuffed toys too.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and more materials and fabric

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
El Sr. Fermin es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 55 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Graciela de 38 años de edad. Tiene 2 hijos, todos en edad escolar.
Tiene un Automóvil en el cual trabaja como taxi de pasajeros, tiene 2 puestos de trabajo, mercado municipal y terminal de ómnibus. Tiene una clientela bien formada, lo cual le genera buen ingreso. Nos comenta que tiene buenas referencias comerciales y personales, el es un señor muy trabajador, excelente cliente con la fundación.
El desea seguir ampliándose, y por eso solicita el crédito para la construcción de un salón donde podrá poner sus automóviles. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Fermín, 55, lives in the city of Santaní with his wife, Graciela, 38.  He has two school age children.

He has a car that works as a passenger taxi.  He has two pick-up points: the municipal market and the bus terminal.  He has a well-formed clientele which generates good income.  He comments that he has good personal and commercial references.   He is a very hardworking man and an excellent client of the Fundación.

He wants to continue to grow so is asking for the loan to build a garage where he can keep his automobiles.  He thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it gives him.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Camilo Lorenzo

texts.es:
Camilo Lorenzo tiene 41 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos de 22, 10 y 8 años de edad, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.
LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.
Camilo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá adquirir los insumos.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia, las plagas y el mal tiempo. El sueño es poderse esforzar para reunir dinero y poderles brindar a la familia buena estabilidad económica.
En los tiempos libres le gusta esforzarse en el trabajo.
texts.en:
Camilo Lorenzo, 41, is married and has three children who are 22, 10 and 8 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “Dulce Sentimiento” communal bank is located in Recinto Caimito II, Puerto Pechiche Parish belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank’s members are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Camilo is a corn, rice and pigeon pea farmer.  His purchases and his sales take place in Ventanas Canton.  He’s asking for a loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain his crops in good condition.  The loan will be very useful because he’ll be able to acquire the supplies. 

The challenges he faces are very frequent: competition, pests and bad weather.  His dream is to be able to make the effort to save up money to provide his family with a good economic stability.  In his free time he likes to work even harder.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha a 47-year-old housewife married to Harb, a 52-year-old man who works in a printing house.

Aisha and her husband started a small business buying large quantities of salt and different types of spices and re-packing then in small packages or small amounts that are not available in the market in special packages of her design. 

Aisha’s husband helps her in printing the packages and in the marketing process. Now Aisha wants to expand her business by buying more spices that are still not included in what she sells, hoping that one day she will be able to open her own spices store in the area.

Because Aisha is a conservative person, she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy more spices to sell

loans.name: Publio Beltran

texts.es:
Publio Beltrán tiene 58 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene cinco hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 34, 28, 24, 22, 19 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Publio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá realizar las compras sin ningún problema.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es comprar terrenos para poder sembrar  y cultivar en grande para que la utilidad sea mejor.

En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Publio Beltrán, 58, lives in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province with his common-law wife and five children, ages 34, 28, 24, 22, and 19.

The Dulce Sentimiento communal bank is located in the Caimito II area of Puerto Pechiche parish in Pueblo Viejo canton.  This bank focuses on short-cycle agriculture growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Publio works in agriculture growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  He buys and sells in Ventanas canton.

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds and agricultural supplies like urea, Mata Monte herbicide, fertilizer, and weedkiller to keep the crops in good condition.  The loan will be a big help because he'll be able to make his purchases with no problem.

The challenges he frequently faces are competition and pests.  His dream is to buy land, to be able to plant and grow in larger quantities so his profits will be greater.

In his spare time he likes to listen to music and play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies like urea, herbicide, fertilizer, and weed killer.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude lives in  Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (3 orphans). Gertrude has a business of tailoring.  She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Gertrude sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. Gertrude has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more spools of clothing materials (fabric). She also generates additional income through selling bridal jewelry. The main business challenges for Gertrude include defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal shop and also own a tailoring school. Gertrude lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent for her business premises and paying for electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy more spools of clothing materials (fabric)

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three school-going children. Her husband is a fisherman who contributes to the providing the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Mariam has operated a business selling leso (kanga) for the past six years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of transporting her products from point of purchase to her place of business. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase more pairs of lesos to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because their policies suit low-income earners.

loans.use: To purchase more pairs of lesos to sell

loans.name: Yolanda Lilian

texts.es:
A sus 25 años de edad Yolanda es una mujer y madre emprendedora que decidió montar su propio negocio como una ayuda económica para sacar a su hija adelante. Yolanda tiene una tienda general en el municipio La Unión en el departamento de Antioquia, sueña con tener mas espacio y mercancía donde acomodar el negocio pues tiene la fortuna de no tener competencia en el sector, por lo que ve una gran oportunidad de progreso.

Yolanda quiere comprar un surtido mayor para su negocio, logrando generar más utilidades, ampliando la variedad en el producto y aumentando las ventas, de manera que mas clientes lleguen a su negocio y se pueda posicionar, sin embargo ella no cuenta con el monto necesario para comprar la mercancía, y por esto hoy solicita un crédito para invertir en gaseosas, dulces, snack, licor e insumos para la preparación de comida rápida, con esta mercancía su negocio será beneficiado y su calidad de vida mejorará notablemente.
texts.en:
At 25 years of age Yolanda is an enterprising woman and mother who decided to start her own business as a source of economic support to help her daughter get ahead. Yolanda has a general store in the town of La Unión in Antioquia department. She dreams of having more space and merchandise to accommodate her business since she is fortunate in lacking any competition in the area and consequently sees a great opportunity to make progress.

Yolanda wants to buy a larger stock of supplies for her business and generate more profits by expanding the variety of products and increasing sales so that more customers come to her business and she is able to better position herself. Nevertheless she does not have the sum needed to buy the merchandise and because of this she is requesting a loan today to invest in soft drinks, sweets, snacks, liqueurs and the supplies to prepare fast food. With this merchandise, her business will benefit and her quality of life will markedly improve.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sweets, snacks, liqueurs and supplies to prepare fast food.

loans.name: Zulma Beatriz

texts.es:
La Sra. Zulma es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Dario de 41 años de edad. Juntos tienen 4 Hijos, todos menores de edad, en edad escolar.
Ella tiene una Despensa en su domicilio particular, la cual está bien surtida con todo tipo de productos. Comenta que tiene clientela bien formada, lo cual la ayuda mucho, pues le genera un buen ingreso. Ella se define como una mujer trabajadora, luchadora y por sobre todo muy emprendedora. Ella dice que por medio de este trabajo ella ayuda a su marido con los gastos de la casa y también en la educación de los hijos
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, leche, panificados, carne, embutidos, hortalizas y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zulma lives in the city of Santaní.  She’s 36 years old, married to Darío, 41, and they have four children who are all minors and school age.

She has a grocery store at home that’s well-stocked with all sorts of products.  She comments that she has a well-formed clientele which helps her a lot because it generates good income.  She defines herself as a hardworking, tenacious but, above all, very enterprising woman.  She says that through this work she helps her husband meet household expenses and also pay for her children’s education.

She is asking for the loan to buy sugar, milk, baked goods, meat, cured meats, vegetables and others to stock her business and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Amelia Sabrina

texts.es:
Amelia Sabrina tiene 29 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene cinco hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Amelia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá invertir en la agricultura y compra de los abonos.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia, las plagas y el mal tiempo. El sueño es poderse esforzar para reunir dinero y poderse comprar una desgranadora de maíz, un carro y una casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta lavar la ropa.
texts.en:
Amelia Sabrina is 29 years old. She is in a common-law marriage. She has five children and lives with her partner and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province.

The Dulce Sentimiento communal bank is located in the Recinto Caimito II in the Puerto Pechiche parish which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. The members of this communal bank are work with short cycle crops like corn, rice and beans.

Amelia farms corn, rice and beans. She makes sales and purchases in the Ventanas canton. She is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and farming supplies like urea, fertilizers and weed killers in order to maintain the crops. This loan will help a lot because it can be invested in the farm and it will purchase fertilizers. The challenges she faces frequently are competition, pests and bad weather. Her dream is to be able to save money and to purchase a corn husking machine, a vehicle and a house. In her free time, she likes to do laundry.

loans.use: purchase seeds and farming supplies  like urea, fertilizers and weed killers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Walter Jesus

texts.es:
Walter Jesus  tiene 33 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene una hija, vive con la esposa y con la hija de nueve meses de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Walter se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá comprar los insumos agrícolas.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son las plagas. El sueño es comprar terrenos para poder sembrar  y cultivar para luego venderlo a un buen precio que sea rentable para la familia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta ver cómo juegan futbol.
texts.en:
Walter Jesus is 33 years old and lives with his common law partner and 9 month old daughter in the canton of Ventanas in the Ríos province.
The community bank LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO can be found in Recinto Caimito II, in the parish of Puerto Pechiche which is part of the Pueblo Viejo canton. This is a place of short-cycle agricultural workers who sow corn, rice, and pigeon beans.
