Shalom Isabel es una madre joven que  saca adelante a su familia, ella no solo se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza sino hace 4 meses atrás abrió un bar. Shalom Isabel no solo se dedica a su familia sino no se descuida en lo personal y está estudiando la carrera profesional de Historia en la Universidad nacional de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Shalom Isabel con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Shalom Isabel requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercedaria como por ejemplo perfumes, anillos, lápiz labial y otras cosas más. 

Shalom Isabel se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Shalom Isabel continues as a member of one of Asociación Arariwa's community banks which is based in the city of Cusco.  She continues selling beauty products through catalogs.

Shalom Isabel is a young mother who is providing for her family.  She doesn't just sell beauty products but, four months ago, she also opened a bar.  She looks after her family but doesn't neglect herself as she is studying for a degree in history at the National University of the City of Cusco. 

Shalom Isabel's previous loan went very well and she was able to make good profits.  For this reason, she would like another loan as they help her a lot.

Shalom Isabel needs this loan to buy more merchandise such as perfumes, rings, lipsticks and other products.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as perfumes, rings, lipsticks, etc.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a mother of two, ages seven and two years old. She has been in mixed farming for the last seven years, producing potatoes, maize, milk and beans for the local market. She also does  hairdressing on call for additional income.

Jacqueline has requested a loan for 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. She says the acquisition of the birds will improve her farming income and enable her to educate her children. She also has plans to add more dairy cows to increase her milk production and income.

She mentions a lack of adequate rainfall and diseases as the challenges she is facing.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is Aminata, who is 37 years old. She is married to a policeman and has 3 children, aged 4, 10, and 13, all of whom are attending school. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her because she doesn't have a male child. 

In 1993, Aminata established her baby clothing business. She previously worked with her elder sister, who, after some years, gave her some money to establish her own business. Aminata's business is special to her because she makes more profit.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 2,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from the business. She serves about 18 customers every day; her business is popular because she is the only one selling baby items along a busy street in the city center.

Aminata would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans and now requires a new loan in order to purchase the following items: 2 bales of cotton napkins @ 2,400,000 SLL, 1 bale of towels @ 1,080,000 SLL, and 10 dozen baby panties @ 450,000 SLL.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL.

In the future, Aminata plans to build her own house and educate her children up to university level, an opportunity she did not have. She is glad to obtain this loan because it will help her to improve her business. Her major challenge is weather, especially during the rains. She has only has an umbrella to cover her items. She ploughs back profits into the business and plans to expand her business with additional loans. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase the following items: 2 bales of cotton napkins @ 2,400,000 SLL, 1 bale of towels @ 1,080,000 SLL, and 10 dozen baby panties @ 450,000 SLL.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 36 años, es una luchadora madre soltera. Que cuida sola a sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Tambo. Desde que se quedó sola al cuidado de sus hijos. Ella busco la forma de ganarse el dinero para sobrevivir. Es por ello que incursionó en lo que más sabe, “la costura”. Confecciona faldas típicas de toda variedad, fustanes, mantas y demás accesorios que utiliza las personas del campo todos los días y en festividades. Le va muy bien pues su taller se encuentra en una zona céntrica al lado del mercado de la ciudad de Huancayo. Ya tiene 4 años de experiencia y en todo este tiempo, aprendió muchas cosas. Como vender ropa diversa en festividades del país, ahí obtiene un dinero extra, con lo que puede solventar los gastos del hogar. Ahora quiere mejorar su negocio y convertirla en un taller reconocido. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este es el duodécimo crédito con MFP,  donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Liz, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ropa para estas fiestas navideñas.
texts.en: Liz is 36 years old. She is a tenacious single mother who cares for her two children alone in her own home, in Tambo district. When she was left alone to look after her children, Liz looked for a way to earn money so that they could survive. She decided to start working at what she knew best (sewing). She makes all kinds of traditional skirts, slips, mantas (squares of cloth which are worn as shawls or used as baby carriers) and other accessories that country people use every day and during holiday periods. Her business is doing very well as her workshop is located in a central area, next to Huancayo city market. She has four years experience and, over the years, she has learned many things such as how to sells clothes during holiday periods. This makes her extra money with which to cover her household expenses. She would now like to improve her business and turn it into a well-known workshop. Liz is a member of the IDME community bank and this is her 12th loan from MFP. She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals. For her part, she pledges once again to make her repayments in a timely manner. Liz enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people. With your support, Liz will invest the money she has requested in buying clothes for the Christmas holiday season.

loans.use: to buy clothing for the upcoming Christmas season

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria Cristina sigue participando en el banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Maria Cristina sigue dedicándose a la venta de esponjas de baño y otros accesorios, ella también sigue con el negocio de venta de comida. 

Maria Cristina con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Maria Cristina requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. 

Maria Cristina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Qorichaska del Cusco”, which is part of the microfinance organization Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. She still sells bath sponges and other accessories, but she also continues her business of selling food.

Her previous loan went very well and she was able to obtain good benefits. For this reason, she wants another loan because she believes it will help a lot. Maria Cristina plans to buy more supplies such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other products.

She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Beatriz Virginia

texts.es:
Beatriz Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del, distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo en edad escolar.  La señora estudio educación superior.

Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artesanía en bordados.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevo soles comprará bordados en bayeta y lanas para su respectivo negocio.

Su sueño de la señora es tener una casa propia.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los temas respecto al negocio y el compartir con las socias.
texts.en:
Beatriz Virginia is a member of the Communal Bank “Aymaras Juli II” which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 32 years old, single, and has a child who is in school. Sra. Beatriz received her higher education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling embroidered handicrafts.

With this new loan of 1700 PEN, she will buy embroideries made of cloth and wool for her business. Her dream is to have a house of her own. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the business-related seminars and being able to share with the other members.

loans.use: to buy embroideries made of cloth and wool.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, D. 57 años; es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía D. Pedro, su esposo desD. hace 35 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo cuidan D. 4 D. ellos, todos menores D. edad, juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo D. San pedro D. saño. DesD. que formó su familia, comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, todo ello para el sustento D. su familia. Como mujer del campo, se dedica a la siembra D. maíz y habas en sus propios terrenos agrícolas a diferencia D. los demás agricultores, ella centra sus ventas en diferentes zonas, cuando el precio es bueno, lo venD. en el anexo D. concepción pero si desminuye. Viaja a diferentes zonas, donD. los comerciantes D. alimentos, le paguen mayor precio por sus cosechas. Durante sus viajes, se ingenió para vender a la vez, animales menores y semillas para la germinación D. los diversos alimentos que produce la tierra, todo esto gracias a su disposición en el trabajo. Ahora espera mejorar sus cultivos, ya que observo que depenD. D. la calidad su ganancia. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “san pedro” y este es veinteavo crédito con MFP, donD. se siente contenta D.  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura D. avanzar con su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas. Elena D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. fertilizantes naturales para su próximo sembrío D. maíz.
texts.en:
Elena is 57 years old.  She is a modest woman who lives with her husband of 35 years, Pedro.  Together they have eight children, but they only take care of four of them, all of whom are minors.  They live together in their own home located in the San Pedro D. Saño District.  

Since she started her family, she began to do different kinds of work, all to support her family.  As a country woman, she plants corn and broad beans on her own farmland.  Unlike other farmers, she focuses her sales in different areas.  When the price is good, she sells in the district of Concepción, but when it goes down, she travels to different regions where the food dealers will give her a better price for her produce.  During her travels, she learned to sell young animals and seeds for the various foods the land produces, all thanks to her aptituD. for this work.  Currently, she hopes to improve her crops, as she knows that her earnings depend on their quality.  

She belongs to the San Pedro Solidarity Group and this is her twentieth loan with MFP, where she is happy to know that she has financial support as this gives her the confidence to move forward with her business.  She promises to make her payments on time.  Upon receiving your support, Elena will use the loan money to buy natural fertilizers for her next corn planting.

loans.use: to buy bags of natural fertilizers

loans.name: Jhanet

texts.es: Jhanet, de 20 años; es una joven responsable. Vive en compañía de sus abuelos Pedro, su abuela Victoria y sus tíos a los que quiere mucho. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Chamiseria. Su principal sueño es estudiar ingeniería forestal en la universidad del estado, sabe que es un camino largo por recorrer, sobre todo porque no tiene el apoyo de sus padres. Con ese rumbo ella trabaja sin descanso, pues quiere ahorrar todo lo que pueda. Su actividad económica es la confección de mandiles de buena calidad, los cuales elabora con mucho esmero. Cuenta que elabora 2 ejemplares durante el día, los cuales vende a 130 nuevo soles, ganando un promedio de 70 soles por unidad, “la ganancia varía, todo depende de la calidad de tela y de modelo que elaboró”, menciona. Ahora ella planea comprar máquinas industriales con las que pueda poner un taller equipado que produzca mayores faldas y con mejores acabados. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “santa clara de asís” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Jhanet, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de telas, ovillos y una máquina de coser rústica para su negocio.
texts.en: Jhanet, 20, is a responsible young lady who lives with her grandparents, Pedro and Victoria, and her uncles, whom she loves very much.  They live in their own house in the Chamiseria annex.  Her main goal is to study forest engineering at the state university, which she knows will be a long haul because she does not have the help of her parents.  With this in mind she works tirelessly and saves all she can.  Her business is making top quality aprons, which she does very carefully.  She says she can make two aprons a day which she sells for 130 PEN, averaging an income of 70 PEN per unit.  "Profits vary, depending on the quality of the fabric and the style I make.", she says.  Now she plans to buy an industrial machine to put in her workshop so she can produce more goods with a better finish.  She belongs to the communal bank "Santa Clara de Asís" and this is her third loan through MFP.  She is counting on your support, so she can strive to reach her goals, and is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She enjoys being a part of the communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive.  Jhanet plans to use the loan to buy fabric, yarn and a rustic sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: To buy fabric, yarn and a rustic sewing machine.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras J. II” del, distrito J., provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.

La señora se dedica a la venta de artesanía como tejidos en estacas, agujas, ponchos, llicllas, fajas, frazadas y los vende en las ferias de la zona. Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará lanas de diferentes colores para sus tejidos, el kilo lo compra en S/. 40.00 nuevo soles en Juliaca.  Su esposo trabaja como músico.

La señora desea tener más capital para mejorar su negocio y tener más ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es el ahorro, la ganancia y la facilidad con la que otorgan un préstamo.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the communal bank "Aymaras J. II" in the J. District, province of Chucuito, in the department of Puno.  She is 28 years old, married and has two children.  She has a secondary level education.

She sells crafts such as woven textiles, needles, ponchos, illicllas (skirts), girdles, and blankets which she sells at the trade fairs in her area.  Her initial loan of 200 PEN was invested in her business.

She plans to use the new 500 PEN loan to buy different colored yarn for her woven products.  She buys a kilo for 40 PEN in Juliaca.  Her husband works as a musician.

Beatriz wants more capital to improve her business and increase earnings.  What she enjoys most about the communal bank is learning how to save and make a profit, as well as the ease with which loans are granted.

loans.use: To buy different colored yarn.

loans.name: Dennys Eduardo

texts.es:
Dennys pertenece al banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” y las reuniones de los socios del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco de la provincia del Cusco. 

Dennys tiene 21 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, él nació en la ciudad de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Dennys es la distribución de “papitas ligth”. Desde abril de este año compra los productos de una marca conocida y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Dennys requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como “papitas ligth”. 

Dennys agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Dennys belongs to the communal bank "Qorichaska del Cusco" which holds member meetings every month in the city and province of Cusco.

Dennys is 21 years old and has a common-law wife and a son.  He was born in the city of Cusco which is where he lives now and runs his business distributing "papitas light" (light potato chips).  Since April of this year he has been buying the products of a well-known brand, and thanks to his hard work business is doing well.

On this occasion Dennys needs a loan to buy wholesale merchandise, such as the "papitas light".  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale goods.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 56 años, es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Raúl, su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo cuidan a 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de San pedro de saño. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, sus sembríos constan de maíz y papa. Los cuales cuida con mucho esmero pues tiene que cuidar la calidad de sus cosechas, ya que en temporada de recolección los mismos comerciantes visitan sus terrenos para negociar los alimentos. La ayuda de su esposo es vital, pues juntos toman decisiones para afrontar las dificultades; como la falta de peones o las plagas que azotan sus cultivos. Como es una mujer del campo, también se dedica a la ganadería; con la crianza de 2 vacas que le brindan la leche que después vende a los pobladores de su localidad. Ahora ella desea comprar más terrenos agrícolas, porque tiene planes de seguir sembrando en mayor cantidad. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “san pedro” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Rosa de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de maíz.
texts.en: Rosa, 56, is a cheerful woman. She lives with Raul, her husband of 20 years. They have 3 children but only take care of 2 of them in their own house which is located in the annex of San Pedro de Saño. Her main economic activity is farming. She plants corn and potatoes which she tends with great care as she must ensure the quality of her produce as at harvest time the very merchants visit her farm to negotiate for the produce. Her husband's help is crucial as together they make decisions to confront any difficulties such as a lack of labourers or the pests that afflict her crops. As she is a country woman she also keeps livestock, breeding 2 cows which give her milk that she subsequently sells to people of her area. She now wants to buy more farmland because she has plans to continue planting in large quantities. She belongs to the communal bank "San Pedro" and this is the 7th loan with MFP. She hopes for your collaboration so as to pursue her goals. She also promises once more to make her repayments. In addition, she likes being a part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible people and very united. Rosa, on receiving your support, will invest the money requested in the purchase of several sacks of natural fertilizers for her next crop of corn.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata est âgée  de 55 ans. Elle habite au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le commerce de produits alimentaires comme les oignons, l'ail etc...  Elle a choisi cette activité dans le but de se procurer des revenus. Elle est sociétaire de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de denrées alimentaires en vue de renforcer son stock.  Ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter sa capacité de vente  et  d’accroitre ses bénéfices. Ainsi elle pourra mieux se prendre en charge et soutenir ses proches.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata is 55 years old. She lives in Senegal.

She is active in trading food products such as onions, garlic, etc ... She chose this activity in order to generate income.

She is a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches and is requesting a credit of 200,000 francs to purchase food products so that she can increase her stock supply.

This funding will allow her to increase her sales capacity and consequently her profits. In this way she will be better able to control her activity and support her family.

loans.use: purchase local grain cereals for retail sales

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.es: Ligia Maria tiene 24 años y ella se dedica a la venta y distribución de queso ella desea invertir el crédito en la compra de grandes cantidades de queso. Aprendió con su abuelita y su mama. Con el objetivo del préstamo espera poder independizarse de su familia y mejorar cada día. Ella tiene ubicado su negocio en un lugar donde transitan muchos clientes y aprovechan los buenos precios que ofrece.
texts.en: Ligia Maria is 24 years old and she sells and distributes cheese. She wants to invest the loan in buying large quantities of cheese. She learned from her grandmother and her mother. With the loan she hopes to become independent from her family and improve every day. Her business is in a place where there are a lot of customers and they take advantage of the good prices she offers.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Jorge tiene 26 años y vive en la aldea de Cofradía. Es casado y tiene dos hijos con su esposa Alba. La niña tiene 5 años de edad y ya asiste a la escuela. El niño tiene 3 años de edad. 

Don Jorge alquila un local en Cofradía donde tiene una tienda de joyería y relojería. Aprendió el oficio junto a su madre, con la cual había trabajo por 10 años. Hace 2 años se puso su propio local. Tenía el deseo de contar con un negocio propio y de aumentar sus ingresos. Trabaja en la tienda junto con su esposa. En el local, Jorge vende y compra joyas y relojes y, repara relojes y alajas. La reparación se consiste en cambiar baterías y brazaletes.

Jorge va a utilizar este préstamo de L20,000 para expandir sus servicios y ofrecer el empeño de objetos de oro y plata. Don Jorge también pretende aumentar su inventario de joyas y relojes. Su meta propia es  poner varias tiendas en la área para poder dar su familia un mejor futuro económico.
texts.en:
Jorge, age 26, lives in the village of Cofradía.  He is married to Alba, and he has two children.  His daughter is five years old, and she goes to school.  His son is three years old.

Jorge rents a place in Cofradía where he has a jewelry and watch store.  He learned this trade together with his mother, with whom he worked for ten years.  Two years ago he established his own place.  He had the wish to have his own place and to increase his income.  He works with his wife in the store.

In his place he buys and sells jewelry and watches, and he repairs watches and jewelry.  The repairs consist of changing batteries and watchbands.

Jorge will use the loan of 20,000 lempiras to expand his services and to offer to pawn gold and silver objects.

His goal is to set up various stores in the area in order to be able to give his family a better financial future.

loans.use: to expand his services and to start to pawn gold and silver objects.

loans.name: Sohir

texts.en:
Sohir is a 36-year-old mother of three with extensive tailoring and seamstress experience. Sohir has gained an excellent reputation in her village and surrounding area. She and two partners are opening a shop where she will provide tailoring and dressmaking services.

Sohir needs this loan to purchase a sewing machine, paint for the shop, sewing materials, cloth and supplies.

In the future Sohir wants to see her business expand, become a leader in the field, and get involved in designing.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, paint for the shop, sewing materials, cloth and supplies.

loans.name: Yaffa

texts.en:
Yaffa is a 24-year-old mother of four. She is a trained child minder and opened her at-home daycare last year. Yaffa has created a warm environment for the children in her care but she needs additional equipment.

Yaffa needs this loan to purchase a table, chairs, mattresses, toys & games, a first aid kit and supplies.

Yaffa wants to continue and expand her daycare and ensure a steady number of children for years to come.

loans.use: to purchase a table, chairs, mattresses, toys & games, a first aid kit and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock for the new school year, purchase a refrigerator, and expand her range of merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional chicks and feed and renovate the hutch where she raises them.

loans.name: Rhonda

texts.en:
Rhonda is a 29-year-old businesswomen from Turan in northern Israel. She opened her hair & bridal salon in 2009. After gaining clients Rhonda moved her salon to a more central and attractive location this year. Rhonda, a charismatic and dedicated stylist, has gained a reputation of dedication to her clients and of being a top-notch professional.

Rhonda needed this loan for minor renovations in her new salon, supplies, additional equipment and evening dresses for rental.

Rhonda hopes one day to be the salon in her area creating exclusivity in bridal needs and everyday styling. She also wants to train others from her area in the profession.

loans.use: to make minor renovations in her new salon and buy supplies, additional equipment and evening dresses for rental.

loans.name: Zahava

texts.en:
Zahava is a widow from Kiryat Ono. For years she ran a business established by her late husband. The business has continued with business partners. In order not to be dependent on this business partnership as her sole source of income, Zahava has begun expanding her business activity of cosmetics from her home-based salon. For years she provided cosmetics services to individuals here and there but is now establishing a business activity from her home. She has already begun to build a steady and loyal group of clients.

Zahava needed this loan to purchase cosmetic supplies and equipment to professionalize her home salon.

In the future Zahava wants to develop a steady flow of income from her business, create a website, and invest in ongoing advertisement.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic supplies and equipment to professionalize her home salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a small refrigerator for her specialty chocolates shop, as well supplies, shelving, an air conditioner and for renovations to the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer and a desk.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: Maria Elsa tiene 68 años, su actividad se dedica al comercio de especies, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamiento por lo que se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de romero, salsas, manzanilla, romero, clavo de olor entre otros. Maria tiene más de 22 años en este negocio, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener ella es una mujer trabajadora y disfruta de tener este medio de vida. sueña con ampliar su negocio cada dia.
texts.en: Maria Elsa is 68 years old and sells spices. This is not the first time that she has had funding for which she is very happy with this way of life. The loan she is requesting is to buy rosemary, sauces, chamomile, cloves among others. Maria has more than 22 years in the business which with a lot of effort she has managed to keep running. She is a hardworking woman and is happy with this way of life. She dreams of growing her business every day.

loans.use: to buy rosemary, sauces, chamomile, cloves and others.

loans.name: Rocio Antonia

texts.es:
Rocio es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene  29  años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo, la señora estudió educación secundaria.

Desde hace once años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará víveres como arroz, azúcar, fideos, papa y otros insumos para la preparación de alimentos, en el negocio le ayuda su esposo.

La señora desea tener un local propio para su restaurante y tener su casa propia.  Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Rocio, 29, is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima community bank in Juli, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno.  She is married and has one son. 

Rocio has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eleven years.  She used her first loan for S/.300.00 new soles to support her food-sales business.  

She is applying for a S/.1500.00 new soles loan now that she will use to buy supplies like rice, sugar, pasta and potatoes, as well as the other ingredients that she needs to make the meals she sells.  Rocio's husband helps her with the business.

Rocio would like to have her own restaurant one day and own a house of her own.  What she most likes about the community bank is that it provides timely loans with reasonable conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her food-sales business.

loans.name: Jacinta Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Con Futuro del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Lleva 10 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica al negocio de alquiler de cuartos, todo este tiempo fue invirtiendo sus préstamos y ganancias en arreglos de su casa para poner habitaciones en alquiler, tiene 9 cuartos alquilados. 
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 bolsas de cemento, 2 metros de ripio, pago de mano de obra del albañil.
Le falta poner piso a dos cuartos mas y quedaran listos para alquilarlos y así obtener mayores ingresos, su esposo tiene una mecánica y comparten los gastos, los ingresos que genera el alquiler los utiliza para hacer continuar con las mejoras en su casa.
Solo espera tener un préstamo mas grade para poder ampliar su casa y tener más cuartos, porque en el lugar que vive es muy solicitado por estar cerca del mercado.
texts.en:
Sra. Jacinta, 59, is a member of the Mujeres Con Futuro community bank in Calleria, a district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali.  She is married and has three children.  
She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 10 years, using loans from the bank support her room-rental business.  She has used the loans over the years, along with her own earnings, to improve the business and she now has 9 rooms for rent.  She will use this loan, for S/.1,500.00 new soles to pay for: 5 bags of cement, 2 [cubic?] meters of gravel and relevant labor expenses.  
Sra. Jacinta needs to lay floors for two more rooms so that she can rent them and increase her revenues from the business.  Her husband is a mechanic and they share household expenses.  She will use the extra income from the new rooms to continue improving the business.  She wants ever-bigger loans so that she can continue to expand.  The house is near the market and there is a lot of demand for her rooms.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, etc. for improvements to her house.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
La señora Elva es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Con Futuro. Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 68 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene seis hijos mayores.
Se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas, su negocio está instalaco en su casa y cuenta con una refrigeradora pequeña donde pone a enfriar sus bebidas, son cuatro años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles compraré: 5 cajas de gaseosa, 10 cajas de cerveza,3 paquetes de agua mineral, 2 paquetes de guaraná, 1 paquete de bolsas, sorbetes, vasos descartables.
Tiene la ayuda de sus nietas que son las que le acompañan y le ayudan en la venta.

Los prestamos que Manuela Ramos le dio le ha servido para trabajar y no depender de sus hijos, las ganancias son para ella sola y le alcanza, se siente muy contenta por todo lo que su negocio le da hasta hoy, espera seguir trabajando por mucho tiempo mas y depender de nadie.
texts.en:
Sra. Elva, 68, is a member of the Mujeres Con Futuro community bank in Calleria, a district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali.  She is a single mother with six grown children.  
She makes a living buying and selling cold drinks, a business that she operates from her house.  She has a small refrigerator where she stores the drinks.  She has supported the business with loans from Manuela Ramos for four years.  
Sra. Elva will use this loan, for S/.1,500 new soles, to buy: 5 cases of soft drinks, 10 cases of beer, 3 packets of mineral water, 2 packets of guarana, 1 packet of bags, sorbets and disposable cups.  
Her granddaughters help her with sales.  

Manuela Ramos loans have given Sra. Elva a way to earn a living.  She doesn't have to depend on her children.  Her earnings are her earnings and they cover her expenses.  She is very grateful for everything the business has brought her and she hopes to continue operating it so that she needn't depend on anyone else.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Con Futuro. Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
Lleva un año trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos,  se dedica  a la venta  de pasamanería, negocio que lo realiza en su casa, acondicionó parte de su sala para poner su pequeño negocio, su hija es la que le ayuda cuando no va al colegio. 
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 caja de mentol, 1caja de vinagre bullí, i caja de betún, 1 caja de hisopos, 3 tiras de champú, 1 caja de lapiceros, 1 docena de esmalte, ½ docena de coloretes.
Son cosas que tiene más salida y que no deben faltar en su negocio, que aun es pequeño pero lo está surtiendo cada vez que saca su préstamo.
Con su negocio puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, porque él trabaja  en una compañía que esta fuera de la ciudad, y lo ven cada fin de mes que es cuando viene a cobrar.
texts.en:
Señora Ana María is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Con Futuro, of the Calleria district in the department of Ucayali. She is 44 years old and has 4 children. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos loans for the last year. She sells ornamental trimmings for garments, a business she runs from home where she converted part of her lounge to install her small business. Her daughter helps her when she isn't at school.

With her new loan of S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy 1 carton of menthol, 1 carton of boiled vinegar, 1 carton of shoe polish, 1 carton of ball-point pens, 1 carton of cotton buds, 1 dozen bottles of nail polish, 1/2 dozen boxes of rouge.

These are products that have a big outlet and should not be missing from her business, which although small she is stocking more with each loan she takes. WIth her business she can help her husband with the household expenses because he works at a company that is out of town and they see him at the end of every month which when he comes to be paid.

loans.use: to buy a carton of menthol, 1 carton of boiled vinegar, 1 box of cotton buds, 3 strips of shampoo, 1 carton of ball-point pens, etc.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa De Jesús tiene 28 años se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo. Tiene más de 10 años con esta actividad, pues gracias a su gran esfuerzo es que ha obtenido lo necesario para brindarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cerdos que son necesarios para su negocio. Ella es una mujer muy responsable espera que su negocio mejore cada día. Sueña con brindarle a su hijo lo necesario para que pueda ser una persona de bien.
texts.en: Teresa De Jesus, 28, operates a business raising and selling pigs.  She has operated the business for more than 10 years and, thanks to her efforts, has managed to earn enough to support her family.  She will use this loan to buy more pigs.  Teresa is a responsible women with high hopes for her business.  What she most wants in the world is to give her son whatever he needs to become the best he can be.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her animal-sales business.

loans.name: Carmen Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es socia D. banco comunal Mujeres Con Futuro D. Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 32 años de edad  y es soltera.
El tiempo que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos le ha servido para poder implementar su negocio, cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su casa.
Con su nuevo préstamo  de  s/.  1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: un saco de arroz, 1 casa de aceite, 1 caja de leche, ½ docena de queso en lata, ½ docena de fruta al jugo, 1 bolsa de fideos, 1 paquete de harina, 1 caja de mantequilla.
Ella atiende personalmente su negocio, pero cuenta con la ayuda de una persona de toda su confianza,  que se encarga de su negocio cuando Carman tiene que ir a estudiar.
Espera terminar su carrera para poder aumentar su capital de negocio y poder manejarlo adecuadamente, agradece a Manuela Ramos por  la ayuda que prestan a las personas que tienen su negocio y quieren mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen, 32, is a member of the Mujeres Con Futuro community bank in Calleria, a district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali.  She is single.
She has used her connection with Manuela Ramos to build up a general store, a business that she operates from her house.  
She will use this loan, for S/.1,500 new soles, to buy: one sack of rice, 1 packet of cooking oil, 1 packet of milk, 1/2-dozen cartons of cheese, 1/2-dozen cartons of fruit juice, 1 bag of pasta, 1 packet of flour and 1 case of butter.
Sra. Carmen runs the store herself, but she has one assistant, someone she trusts, who is in charge of the store when she has to leave it for her studies.  
She hopes to finish her course so that she can learn how to build capital for the business and manage it effectively.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because it provides loans to people who want to own their own businesses and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Juana Gregoria

texts.es: La señora Juana se dedica a brindar el servicio de molino hace 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad, que está ubicado en su vivienda en donde muchos clientes llegan a realizar  los diferentes trabajos. Ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de repuestos para su molino. Es muy buena cliente, trabajadora y muy responsable, ella es madre soltera pero a pesar de sus desventajas ha logrado salir adelante sin ningún problema. Juana se encuentra agradecida por la confianza y el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Ms. Juana has been offering milling services for 12 years.  Her business is set up in her home and she has many customers for whom she provides different jobs.  She is requesting a loan to buy repair parts for her milling machine.  She is a very good, hard-working, responsible borrower.  She is a single mother who, despite the disadvantages, has been able to get ahead without any problems.  Juana is very grateful for the confidence and support.

loans.use: To buy repair parts for her milling machine.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
La señora Deysi es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Con Futuro del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y tiene 1 hijo pequeño.
Es poco tiempo que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos.  Ella se dedica a la confección de bolsos de telas, que los hace a pedidos, cuenta con una pequeña máquina casera, con ella realiza su trabajo.
Con su nueva préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 kilos de tela, 1 kilo de tela para forro, 2 docenas de broches, 10 metros de sierre, 20 metros de soguillas, ojalillos.
Cuando tiene que coser su hermana le ayuda con el cuidado de su niño, su esposo se desempeña como trabajador de limpieza, cuando está en casa  le ayuda con el cuidado de su bebe.
Más adelante espera comprase una máquina adecuada y tener mejores productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, espera que Manuela Ramos le de esa facilidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Deysi is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres con Futuro" in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali.  She is 25 years old, married and has a small son.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for only a short time.  Her business is making cloth bags on an order basis.  She has a home sewing machine that she uses in her work.

With the new 1,500 PEN loan she plans to buy 3 kilos of fabric, 1 kilo of lining fabric, 2 dozen closures, 10 meters of zippers, 20 meters of rope, button holes.  When she is busy sewing her sister looks after her son.  Her husband is a cleaning sector employee and when he is home he helps take care of the baby.

In the future she hopes to have a more appropriate machine so she can offer better products to her customers.  She is counting on Manuela Ramos for support.

loans.use: To buy 3 kilos of fabric, 1 kilo of lining fabric, 2 dozen closures, 10 meters of zippers, 20 meters of rope, button holes.

loans.name: Geremias

texts.es:
El señor Geremias tiene 34 años de edad y vive en un barrio ubicado en la aldea rural de Naco. Lleva más de 10 años de casado con su esposa Magdalena, la cual era comerciante. Sus 4 hijos tienen 17, 15, 11 y 8 años de edad y todos están estudiando. Geremias mantiene su familia de 6 con las ventas de su pulpería. 

Empezó su negocio con el poco dinero que tenía ahorrado y con unos créditos de ODEF. La pulpería vende productos de la canasta básica como leche, carne, huevo, arroz, frijol y sal entre otras cosas. También ofrece comida chatarra, refrescos y productos de higiene como desodorante, pasta de dientes y papel higiénico. Don Geremias trabaja 7 días a la semana para atender bien a su clientela. 

Con el préstamo actual de L22,000, Geremias va a aumentar su inventario de estos productos. Espera crecer más y superarse como un micro-empresario para darle a su familia una vida más saludable. Le importa mucho la educación de sus hijos y espera poder darles la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Geremias, age 34, lives in a neighborhood in the rural village of Naco.  He has been married to his wife, Magdalena, for over ten years.  She was a merchant.  Their four children are 17, 15, 11, and 8 years old.  All of the children attend school.  Geremias supports his family of six with the sales from his grocery store.

He started his business with the little bit of money that he saved and with some loans from ODEF.  The grocery store sells basic needs products like milk, meat, eggs, rice, beans, and salt, among other things.  He also offers fast food, soft drinks and hygiene products like deodorant, toothpaste, and toilet paper.  Geremias works seven days a week in order to tend to his customers.

With the current loan for 22,000 lempiras Geremias will increase his inventory of these products.  He hopes to grow more and to excel as a small businessman in order to give his family a healthier life.  His children’s education is very important to him, and he hopes to be able to give them the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy food and hygiene products.

loans.name: Benigno Julio

texts.es:
Julio pertenece al banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” y las reuniones de los socios del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco de la provincia del Cusco. 

Julio tiene 42 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, él nació en la ciudad de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Julio es la reparación y mantenimiento de computadoras, él tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde brinda sus servicios de reparar computadoras. Desde hace 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Julio requiere el préstamo para comprar más repuestos como cables, lectores, memorias, microprocesadores, mouses, teclados otras cosas más. 

Julio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Julio belongs to the communal bank “Qorichaska del Cusco” and the members meet every 30 days in the city of Cusco in the province of Cusco.

Julio is 42 years old, married and has 2 children. He was born in the city of Cusco and he lives and does business in the same city he was born in. His main economic activity is the repair and maintenance of computers. He has a small workshop in his house where he offers repair services. He has been doing this work for 12 years and he is doing very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

This time Julio needs a loan to buy spare parts such as cables, monitors, memories, microprocessors, mouses, keyboards and a few other things.

Julio is grateful for and values the loan and agrees to make his monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy more replacements such as cables, monitors, microprocessors, mouses, keyboards and a few other things.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
María Cecilia es una mujer D. 60 años D. edad, es una mujer casada y madre D. 2 hijos, aunque actualmente vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en su empleo. DesD. hace 15 años, María Cecilia aprendió el oficio D. la confección, pero solo hace 2 años decidió emprender su propio negocio, un taller D. confección donD. realiza sus propios diseños y también confecciona a terceras personas, mediante este empleo le facilita trabajo a 2 personas más. 

Actualmente María Cecilia solicitó un préstamo para comprar una maquina fileteadora, que le esta haciendo falta en su taller para poder cumplir con mas contratos y aumentar la capacidad D. producción, teniendo como efecto, más clientes, mayores ingresos y un aumento proporcional D. su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María Cecilia is a 60 year old woman. She is married and has 2 children. She currently lives with her husband who supports her in her work. Maria Cecilia leaned dressmaking 15 years ago but it was only 2 years ago that she decided to start her own business, a dressmaking workshop where she 
produces her own designs and also sews for third parties. Through this business she provides employment for 2 other people. 

Currently Maria Cecilia is asking for a loan to buy a skiver machine which she needs in the workshop to meet more orders and increase production capacity, which in effect will increase client numbers, mean bigger returns and a proportional increase in her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a skiver machine to increase production capacity.

loans.name: Rosa Angela

texts.es:
Rosa es una microempresaria que ha luchado incansablemente para mejorar su calidad de vida, actualmente se dedica a la cría y engorde de pollos y credos, esta labor la realiza en compañía de su familia lo que ha hecho que la unión familiar se fortalezca con el negocio.

Actualmente, con la ilusión de aprovechar la temporada de fin de año Rosa quiere hacer algunas adecuaciones locativas a su negocio y comprar mas cerdos y pollos, pero no cuenta con el capital para hacerlo, por lo que solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mas animales y las modificaciones de infraestructura pertinentes para el bienestar de los pollos y los cerdos, as{i en la temporada de diciembre cuando sube la demanda ella tendrá la capacidad de comercializar, generar mas utilidades e incrementar proporcionalmente sus ingresos
texts.en:
Rosa is a micro-entrepreneur who has fought tirelessly to improve her quality of life. Currently, she raises and fattens chickens and pigs. She does this work with her family because family unity strengthens the business.

Now, Rosa wants to take advantage of this period of time near the end of the year. She wants to make some changes to her business and buy more pigs and chickens but she does not have the capital to do so. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more animals and the infrastructure modifications necessary for the well-being of the pigs and chickens. December is the time of year when the demand for her products increases. She will have the capacity to market, generate more profits and proportionately increase her income.

loans.use: make infrastructure modifications and purchase pigs and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto de 40 años, convive con Haydee de 36 años, fruto de su amor tienen 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de puerto amargura. Alberto es un padre muy sacrificado, quien día a día  se esmera en el campo para poder darles una buena educación a sus queridos hijos. Él se dedica a cultivar y cosechar frutas cítricas como el tangello,  mandarina, limón, asimsimo posee una parcela de platanal. Sus frutos tiene mucha demanda en el mercado. El está contento con este oficio que tiene, pues le genera buenas ganancias. En un futuro desea comprarse una movilidad para poder trasladar su producto y llevar a los mismos clientes sin intermediarios. En el trabajo siempre cuenta con el apoyo de peones, quienes lo facilitan en la limpieza del terreno y en la extracción de los productos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo de una vez más ratifica su compromiso de pagar muy puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Alberto esta contento con su banco comunal por que son solidarios y puntuales. Con los 2,000 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de una maquina para sacar la maleza de su campo agrícola
texts.en: Alberto, who is 49, lives with Haydee, 36, and as a result of their love, they have three children. Together, they live in their own house located in the town center of the Amargura port. Alberto is a very sacrificing father who day after day strives in the countryside to be able to give a good education to his dear children. He is dedicated to growing and harvesting citrus fruit such as tangello, mandarin, lemon. He also has a plot of bananas. His fruit generates a lot of demand in the market. He is happy with this job that he has because it generates good income. In the future, he wishes to buy transportation so he can transport his product and take it to more customers without intermediaries. In his work, he always counts on the support of workers who help him with cleaning the land and with the extraction of the products. This will be his second loan with MFP for which he once again promises to repay on time. Alberto is happy with his community bank because they are united and punctual. With the 2,000 soles, he will invest in the purchase of a machine to remove weeds from his farm land.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to remove the weeds.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer emprendedora dedicada a su negocio, donde se dedica a la estampación textil,  en compañía de su esposo trabajan todos los días para entregar los pedidos a tiempo y prestar un servicio que se caracterice por la efectividad y la calidad del producto.

Sueña con poderle ofrecer a su hijo un mejor futuro, estabilizarse económicamente y así mejorar su calidad de vida, actualmente ve la necesidad de comprar más pinturas con las que se estampa, pero no tiene el capital necesario para hacer esta compra por lo que solicita un crédito que invertirá en esas herramientas de trabajo que son indispensables para la producción, la calidad y la efectividad.
texts.en:
Diane is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business, textile printing. Together, she and her husband work every day to fill orders on time and to produce a product characterized by its effectiveness and quality.  

She dreams of being able to provide a better future for her son, establishing herself economically and thus improving her quality of life. Currently she sees the necessity of buying more of the dyes used for printing, but lacks  the capital necessary to make this purchase. Consequently, she is requesting a loan which will be invested in those tools of the trade that are indispensable for production, quality and effectiveness.

loans.use: to buy dyes for textile printing.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: La señora Antonia vive en casa familiar en la zona los andes con su esposo e hijos en la casa de sus suegros hace mas de 25 años. El crédito que solicita es para surtir con variedad de productos como refrescos, dulces galletas su tienda la cual esta ubicada en la zona de rio seco que vende por mayor y menor  su meta  a corto plazo es adquirir la tienda en anticrético ya que por el momento se encuentra en alquiler la señora es antigua clienta  en banca comunal trabajo excelentemente por la cual se animo a solicitar su primer crédito individual  y solo trabaja con emprender su mayor sueño es construir su casita ya que tiene su propio terreno.
texts.en:
Señora Antonia has lived in her in-laws' house, which is located in the Andes area, with her husband and children for the past 25 years. The loan she is applying for is to stock her store, located in the Rio Seco area, with a variety of products, like soft drinks, candy and cookies which she sells at wholesale and retail prices.

Her short-term goal is to obtain the store on an "anticretico" contract (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anticr%C3%A9tico), as at the moment she is renting. This lady is a long-term client of the Communal Bank. She is an excellent worker and is therefore very enthusiastic about applying for her first individual loan. She works to achieve her greatest dream, which is to build her own house as she already has her own plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as soft drinks and candy in order to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy larger amounts of raw materials to save on costs.

loans.name: Smith Julieth

texts.es:
Julieth vive en el municipio de Caldas en el departamento de Antioquia, con su pareja y tienen 1 hijo de dos años de edad. Julieth es una joven emprendedora, la cual desde hace 5 meses decidió que aparte de ser ama de casa, quería colaborar con la economía del hogar y se dedico a vender mercancía en especial Ropa y accesorios.

Julieth sueña con montar su propio almacén de Variedades en el municipio de Carepa y pese a las dificultades para conseguir la mercancía, ya que les toca viajar hasta Medellín a conseguirla, ella lucha por adquirir el capital para hacer su sueño realidad. Actualmente solicitó un préstamo para comprar más productos, antes de que llegue la temporada navideña, ya que en esta época se dificulta mas el viaje hasta Medellín y las cosas allí son mas costosas por temporada, además de esto, Julieth asegura que las ventas en su municipio serán mayores y mejoran sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Julieth lives in the town of Caldas, Antioquia Department, with her spouse; they have a one-year-old son.  Julieth is a young entrepreneur who decided five months ago that besides being a housewife she wanted to contribute to the household economy and decided to start selling merchandise, especially clothes and accessories.

Julieth dreams with opening her own variety store in the town of Carepa and despite the difficulty in getting merchandise that she has to go all the way to Medellín to get she struggles to acquire the capital she needs to make her dream come true.

At present, she requested a loan to buy more products before the Christmas season arrives because during that time the trip to Medellín is even more difficult and things there are more expensive because of  the season.  In addition, Julieth is sure that sales in her town will be larger and her income will improve.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es: Leonidas tiene 31 años, esta casado con René de 28 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 bellos hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de puerto amargura del distrito de LLochegua. Para Leonidas la vida es un regalo, ya que está feliz por haber encontrado muchos caminos por elegir y el desenvolverse en lo que más le gusta. Desde entonces se dedica a la agrícultura, posee una parcela en donde cultiva cacao, actividad que lo hace en compañía de su esposa y peones. Él está feliz por haber elegido esta labor que gracias a ello puede brindarle a sus hijos una buena alimentación, salud, educación, y vivienda. En un futuro desea ampliar la siembra, pues tiene aún tierra por ser cultivada y por ende aumentar su productividad y ganancias. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que una ves más se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles contratará peones para que lo ayuden a limpiar el terreno virgen y luego sembrar cacao.
texts.en:
Leónidas, 31, is married to René, 28, and they have two beautiful children.  They live together in their own house located in the town of Puerto Amargura in Llochegua District.  For Leónidas, life is a gift and he’s happy to have found many paths to choose from and to develop in what he most likes.  Since then he’s been in farming.  He has a parcel where he grows cocoa beans, an activity that he carries out in the company of his wife and hired workers.  He is happy to have chosen this occupation because thanks to it he’s able to provide his children with good food, health, education and housing.  

In the future he’d like to expand the crops because he still has uncultivated land and could increase production and profits.  This will be his second MFP loan so he commits once again to punctually make his installment payments.  He will use the 2000 soles to hire day laborers to help him clear the virgin field and then plant cocoa beans.

loans.use: to hire day laborers to help with farming chores.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Azucena es socia del banco comunal Las Atenas Patillanas del Distrito Yarinacocha D. Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 49 años D. edad, casada, cuatro hijos, solo uno está a su cargo.
Son 22 ciclos que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la crianza D. aves D. corral en pequeña escala, acondicionó un pequeño espacio en su huerta para poner pollos bebes D. granja, que en un mes ya estarán listos para sacar al mercado.
Cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo que es el que se encarga D. la comercialización D. los pollos cuando se encuentran con el peso adecuado.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 100 pollos bebes. 2 sacos D. inicio, 1 frasco D. vitaminas, 5 sacos D. viruta, un frasco D. vacunas, 1 galón D. creso para desinfectar  los ambientes.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad D. tener su propio negocio para el beneficio D. toda su familia, por el trabajo ahora tienen mayor comunicación y lo más importante están unidos.
texts.en:
Azucena is a member of the “Las Atenas Patillanas” communal bank in Yarinacocha District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 49 years old, married and has four children but only one who is still in her care.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos for 22 cycles.  She raises barnyard fowl in small scale; she equipped a small space in her farm to raise baby chicks that will be ready to take to market in one month’s time.  Her husband helps her since he’s the one who takes care of selling them when they reach adequate weight.

She will use her new, 2000 new sol, loan to buy 100 baby chicks, 2 sacks of feed, 1 jar of vitamins, 5 sacks of wood chips, 1 jar of vaccine and 1 gallon of Creso [brand of disinfectant] to disinfect the coops.

She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to have her own business for the benefit of her entire family.  Because of this work they now have better communication and they are together which is most important.

loans.use: to buy 100 baby chicks, 2 sacks of feed, 1 jar of vitamins, 5 sacks of wood chips and one jar of vaccine.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
Rina pertenece al banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” y las reuniones D. los socios del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco D. la provincia del Cusco. 

Rina tiene 42 años D. edad y es casado y fruto D. esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad D. Calca y vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donD. realiza sus actividades económicas. Rina es profesora  y también se dedica  a la elaboración y venta D. artesanía y manualidades. 

En esta oportunidad Rina requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como papel, lana y tela para hacer artesanía y manualidades.  
 
Rina agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rina’s a member of the “Qorichaska del Cusco” communal bank and the members meet every thirty days in the city of Cusco, Cusco Province.

Rina’s 42 years old, married and has two children.  She was born in the city of Calca and lives in the city of Cusco where she carries out her economic activities.  Rina’s a teacher and she also makes manual arts and crafts.

On this occasion Rina needs the loan to buy materials like paper, wool and fabric to make manual arts and crafts.

Rina values and is grateful for the loan and commits to make her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to buy crafts making supplies.

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es:
Juana  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito J., provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 45  años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, uno de ellos es independiente, estudió educación primaria (incompleto).
Trabaja hace más de doce años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió  en la compra de golosinas, la señora también se dedica a la venta de artesanía: bordados en bayeta.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco paquetes de gaseosas de dos litros, agua mineral, golosinas, etc.,  también comprará lanas para sus bordados en bayetas, en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos, su esposo trabaja como transportista.
La señora desea tener una tienda de abarrotes y techar su casa, lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones en temas educativos respecto al negocio, la puntualidad y la alegría con las socias.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima” communal bank located in J. District, Chucuito Province and Puno Department.  She’s 45 years old, married and has three children; one of them is independent.  She went to but did not complete elementary school.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for over 12 years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles and she used it to buy soft-drinks.  She also sells crafts: embroidered baize.

She will use this 800 new sol loan to buy five packets of soft-drinks in two-liter bottles, mineral water, snacks, etc. and will also buy yarn for her embroidery on baize.  Her children help her with the business and her husband works in transportation.

She wants to have a grocery store and to roof her house.  What she likes about her communal bank is the training sessions on educational topics referring to business and punctuality and the joy she shares with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy five packets of two-liter soft-drinks, mineral water, snacks, etc. and also to buy yarn.

loans.name: Luz Estella

texts.es:
A sus 48 años de edad, Luz Estella vive con su esposo y su hijo en el barrio la salle de la ciudad de Medellín, desde hace 7 años consiente de la necesidad de colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, Luz creo su propio negocio, vende en un puesto en una de las principales calles de su barrio comidas rápidas y jugos naturales. 

Ahora Luz Estella, ve la necesidad de irle realizando mejoras a su negocio con el fin de ser mas eficiente y mediante esto atraer nuevos clientes, por eso a solicitado un crédito para comprar 2 licuadoras nuevas al igual que surtido para su negocio, logrando así mejorar sus activos, producir más, mejorar las ventas y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida para brindarles todo lo que se merecen.
texts.en:
At the age of 48, Luz Estella lives with her husband and son in the city of Medellín’s La Salle neighborhood.  Conscious of the need to help her husband meet household expenses Luz started her own business seven years ago.  She sells fast food and natural juices in a stand on one of her neighborhood’s main streets.

Now Luz Estella sees the necessity to do some improvements to her business so that she can be more efficient and attract new customers.  This is why she’s asking for a loan to buy two new blenders as well as ingredients to stock her business thereby having more assets to produce more, improve sales and proportionately her quality of life to provide them with all they deserve.

loans.use: to buy two blenders and ingredients.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: La señora Daniela es cliente de la institución trabajo con el banco de emprendimiento Barrio municipal la señora Daniela vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Bella Vista, Daniela vive en la casa de sus padres por que le ayudan con su pequeña hijita de un año y medio, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en la parada del micro de la zona vende por las noches ya que ella esta estudiando todavía y como la venta la realiza durante dos horas le da tiempo de estudiar , también la Sra. Daniela elabora artesanías como ser collares aretes los cuales los realiza a pedido esto le ayuda a ella con la crianza y los gastos de su pequeña hijita, ella esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de material para las manualidades y compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, es una persona joven pero emprendedora, su deseo es el de poder terminar sus estudios y así de esta manera poder generar mas ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijita y de ella.
texts.en:
Daniela is a client of the institution.  She worked with the Barrio Municipal communal bank.  Daniela lives in her parents' house in the Bella Vista area.  She lives with her parents because they help her with her young daughter, age one and one-half.

Daniela works selling food at the area bus stop.  She sells at night because she is still a student.  And since selling for two hours gives her time to study, she also makes handicrafts like necklaces and earrings, which she makes on order.  This helps her with raising her little girl and covering expenses.

She is requesting the loan to buy material for the handicrafts and to buy supplies to make her food.

She is a young but enterprising person.  Her desire is to be able to finish her studies and so be able to generate more income and improve her quality of life and her daughter's.

loans.use: to buy materials to make handcrafted necklaces and supplies to make food.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos.  Estudió educación secundaria.  Su esposo es policía.
Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artículos artesanales y  compra-venta de ovinos, también se dedica a la agricultura y tiene un locutorio que administra personalmente.
Su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2300.00 nuevo soles, lo invertirá en el arreglo de su tienda de locutorio, mantenimiento de teléfonos y comprar tarjetas, otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en el arreglo de su casa.
Su deseo es poner un negocio de servicio de internet.  Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el compartir y la alegría con las socias.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima” communal bank located in Juli District, Chucuito Province and Puno Department.  She’s 38 years old and has a spouse and three children.  She finished secondary school.  Her husband’s a policeman.

She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  Her first loan was for 500 new soles that she used in her crafts business and to buy sheep.  She’s also a farmer and personally runs a telephone call service center.

She will use her new, 2300 new sol, loan to fix up her call center, service the phones and to buy telephone call cards; another part of the money will be used for home improvements.

She’d like to open an Internet access service.  What she likes about her communal bank is sharing and the joyful time she has with her fellow members.

loans.use: to fix up her phone booth services, service the phones and buy phone cards.

loans.name: Fernando Mauro

texts.es:
Fernando de 25 años, vive una zona urbana llamada “Milagro”.
Su negocio es una peluquería, inicio este negocio hace 5 años, trabajo como empleado en una peluquería y luego con un pequeño capital pudo adquirir su propio negocio.
Su actividad la realiza solo, de lunes a sábado de las 9:00am hasta las 18:00pm, los domingos descansa.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de vitrinas, sillones, tijeras y para el aumento de su negocio.
Su sueño es que pueda salir adelante con su negocio y con la bendición de Dios la compra de un vehículo.
texts.en: Fernando, 25, lives in an urban zone called "Milagro."  His business is a barber shop.  He started it five years ago.  He worked as an employee in a barber shop and then with a little capital was able to acquire his own business.  He works alone Monday through Saturday from 9am until 6pm; he rests Sundays.  He's asking for the loan to buy display cases, armchairs and scissors to increase business.  His dream is to be able to get ahead with his business and with God's blessing to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy display cases, armchairs and scissors.

loans.name: John Wady

texts.es:
A sus 38 años de edad, John es un hombre casado y con un hijo de 12 años, viven en el municipio de Guarne en el departamento de Antioquia y tienen una pequeña fabrica productora de arepas allí mismo. 

Pese a que la competencia en su municipio es muy dura, John sueña con montar toda una industria de la arepa allí, para que todos reconozcan su marca y sus arepas, pero es conciente que para esto necesita fortalecer más muchas áreas como conseguir nuevos mercados. Actualmente en su negocio necesita adquirir nuevos activos como un asador eléctrico que le agilizara su producción al mismo tiempo que cuida su salud y el ambiente, por eso solicito un préstamo para incrementar su activos y aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
At his 38 years, John is a married man with one 12 year old son.  He and his family live in the municipality of Guarne in Antioquia Department.  Right there they have a small "arepas" production factory. (Arepas are a corn-based bread commonly eaten for breakfast)

Despite the fact that the competition in his municipality is tough, John hopes to set up a whole arepa industry there, so that everyone will recognize his brand and his arepas.  But, he is aware that for this to happen, he needs to strengthen his business in many areas, like reaching new markets.  Currently, his business needs to acquire new assets, like an electric grill, which will speed up production and at the same time protect his health and environment.  That is why he is requesting the loan- to increase his assets, his sales and his income.

loans.use: to purchase an electric grill and supplies for making "arepas" (a corn-based bread commonly eaten for breakfast)

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson de 18 años, es soltero y vive en el centro poblado de Puerto Amargura, LLochegua. Cuando Nelson apenas termino la secundaria, se puso a estudiar en "CETPRO" instituto de carrera corta, ahí estudió mecánica en motos y motocicletas, una vez terminado su carrera se dedico a trabajar en el taller de su tío. Desde entonces la gente lo conoce como un buen trabajador, de ahí montó su propio taller y fue que empezó a trabajar de manera independiente y percibiendo ganancias. Actualmente tiene mucho trabajo, que tiempo le falta para reparar las motos de sus clientes. Sin embargo su unico inconveniente es no tener todas las herramientas necesarias, todo esto por el poco capital que tiene, es por esta razón que Nelson recurre a MFP, por un préstamo para poder comprarse mas herramientas y equipos para su taller. Él esta satisfecho por lo que hasta ahora ha logrando, gracias al apoyo de sus padres quienes le dieron. Este será su segundo credito por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles comprará herramientas y equipos para su taller.
texts.en: Nelson is 18 years old and unmarried.  He lives in the town of Puerto Amargura, LLochegua. Nelson had just finished high school when he enrolled in a short-term studies program at CETPRO technical college. There, he studied motorcycle mechanics.  After completing his studies, he began working in his uncle’s garage.  Since then, people have come to know him as a hard worker.  From there, he set up his own garage and began to work independently and make profits.  Now he has so much work that he doesn’t have enough time to repair his customers’ motorcycles.  However, his only drawback is not having enough money to buy all the all the tools he needs. For this reason, Nelson is returning to MFP for a loan to purchase more tools and equipment for his garage.  He is satisfied with what he has achieved so far, thanks to the support his parents have given him.  This will be his second loan and once more, he promises to make his payments on time.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will purchase tools and equipment for his garage.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for his garage. ,

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan carlos es un joven de 23 años de edad, responsable, trabajador y dedicado a su microempresa, fabrica productora de arepas. Este negocio desde hace 10 años hace parte de su familia pero a causas de una enfermedad que tiene su madre, esta no pudo trabajar más y hoy en día es Juan carlos quien se hace responsable de manejar el negocio y de sostener su familia.

Juan carlos sueña con tecnificar cada día mas su fabrica de producción de arepas y ver a su madre recuperada, ya que por su grave estado de salud se le ha dificultado un poco el crecimiento de su empresa. Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar una maquina que le mejorara el moldeado de la masa par las arepas y otra parte para comprar insumos y materia prima, así mejorara la calidad de sus productos y podrá administrar mejor su tiempo para trabajar y compartir con su familia mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a 23 year-old youth who is responsible, hardworking, and dedicated to his small business.  He has a small factory that produces arepas (flat, round patties made of cornmeal that are grilled, boiled or fried.)  This has been a family business for 10 years, but his mother became ill and could not continue working, so today Juan Carlos is the one who is responsible for managing the business and supporting his family.

Juan Carlos dreams of having better technology in his arepas factory, and of seeing his mother recuperate, because her serious health condition has made it difficult to grow the business.  At this time he needs a loan to buy a machine that will improve the process of molding of the dough for the arepas, and to buy supplies and raw materials.  In this way, he will improve the quality of his products and be able to have more time to spend with his family, improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a machine called a "mechanical manufacturer," and supplies to improve the quality of his arepas

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Don Orlando tiene 50 años y vive en San Juan Bosco, una aldea de Cofradía. Orlando tiene 23 años de casado con su esposa Gloria. Él tiene dos pulperías en la zona y Gloria le ayuda atender a la clientela en los locales. La pareja tiene dos hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando. 

Orlando ha dedicado los últimos 16 años a las pulperías. Los puso con el motivo de tener un trabajo propio y de mejorar su nivel de vida. Sus pulperías venden productos básicos como golosinas, lácteos, verduras y otros productos alimenticios.  Además de eso, venden bolígrafos, cuadernos, linternas, jabón y cuerda, entre otros productos.

Las pulperías están ubicadas en un lugar central con buen movimiento, lo cual ha aumentado el rendimiento. Orlando extiende lineas de crédito a su clientela con la anticipación que ellos le van pagando poco a poco. Él nota que a veces, el cobro es un aspecto difícil de su trabajo. 

El señor Orlando ha sacado 12 prestamos anteriores con ODEF. Con este préstamo actual de L20,000, Don Orlando va a aumentar su inventario con la compra de productos de comida y otros artículos. Espera surtir más a las pulperías para poder educar bien a sus hijos. Espera que ellos se gradúen y un día, aprendan a manejar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Orlando, age 50, lives in San Juan Bosco, a village in Cofradía.  Orlando has been married to his wife, Gloria, for 23 years.
