He has two grocery stores in the area, and Gloria helps him tend to the customers at those sites.  The pair has two children, ages 18 and 16.  The children attend school.

Orlando has devoted the past 16 years to the grocery stores.  He established them in order to have his own work and to improve their standard of living.  His grocery stores sell basic products like sweets, dairy products, vegetables, and other food products.  In addition to this, they sell pens, notebooks, flashlights, soap, and string, among other products.

The grocery stores are in a central place with good movement.  This has increased their performance.  Orlando extends lines of credit to his customers with the expectation that they will be paying him little by little.  He notes that sometimes collecting is a difficult aspect of his work.

Orlando has had 12 previous loans with ODEF.  With this current loan for 20,000 lempiras Orlando will increase his inventory with the purchase of food products and other items.  He hopes to stock the grocery stores more in order to be able to educate his children well.  He hopes that they will graduate and one day learn to manage their businesses.

loans.use: to buy food products and other items.

loans.name: Diana Araceli

texts.es:
Diana Araceli de 27 años de edad, casada, vive en la aldea Naco Cortes con su esposo y un hijo de 1 año de edad.  Su esposo  se dedica  a la actividad de enderezado y pintura automotriz.

Diana es muy trabajadora se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz desde las 10:00 a.m  a 1:00 p.m y de 4:00 a 6:00 p.m todos los días.  Debido a la necesidad de obtener mas  ingresos para el hogar, se motivó  a establecer este negocio y lo logró con la ayuda de su madre y  el apoyo de su esposo.  Ahora tiene buena demanda de tortillas, su negocio a crecido ya tiene algunos contratos con los comedores de las maquilas cercanas.

Ha solicitado un  préstamo a ODEF para invertirlo en compra de materia prima (Harina de maíz) y otra parte para compra de materiales  para enderezado y pintura del negocio del esposo.  
Su plan es seguir adelante con su negocio y cuidar su familia.
texts.en:
Diana Araceli is 27 years old and married.  She lives in the village of Naco Cortes with her husband and their one year old son.  Her husband does automotive bodywork and painting.

Diana is very hard-working.  She makes and sells corn tortillas from 10:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. and from 4:00 p.m. until 6:00 p.m. every day.  Due to the necessity of getting more income for the household, she was motivated to establish this business.  

She managed to do so with her mother’s help and her husband’s support.  Now she has a good demand for tortillas.  Her business has grown, and she has some contracts with the dining rooms of the factories that are nearby.

She has requested a loan from ODEF to buy raw material (corn flour).  She will use part of the loan to buy materials for bodywork and painting for her husband’s business.

Her plan is to get ahead with her business and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn flour for tortillas and material for painting automobiles.

loans.name: Oseas

texts.es: Oseas tiene 42 años, esta casado con paulina de 40 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 7 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicando en el centro poblado de Puerto Amargura, LLochegua. Oseas siempre quiso tener su propio campo agrícola donde pudiera ejercer todo lo que sus padres le enseñaron, que es la agricultura. Actualmente tiene un auge productivo en cacao, y esto es gracias a la técnicas que sabe aplicar. Tiene ya 20 dedicándose esta actividad, y hasta el momento siempre ha cumplido con sus objetivos. En un futuro próximo desea ampliar la siembra de cacao, para lograr percibir más dinero. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles pagará a los peones, quienes se dedicarán a podar su parcela de cacao.
texts.en: Oseas is 42 years old, and is married to Paulina, 40.  Together, they have 7 children.  They all live together in their own home, located in the town of Puerto Amargura, in Llochegua.  Oseas always wanted to have his own agricultural business where he could put into practice everything his parents taught him about farming.  Now he his production of cocoa is booming, thanks to the techniques that he knows how to apply.  He has been doing this work for 20 years, and up until now he has always achieved his goals.  In the near future, he wants to expand his plantings of cocoa so that he can earn more money.  This will be his second loan with MFP, and so he is committed once again to making all of his payments on time.  With the 2,000 Peruvian soles requested, he will pay for workers who will prune his cocoa plantings.

loans.use: to hire farm workers

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Eulalia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene  32  años de edad, estado civil casada con tres hijos, con estudios de educación secundaria.

La señora trabaja con Movimiento Manuela Ramos más de once años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de artículos artesanales como manta, bordados en bayeta, venta de golosinas.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1200.00 nuevo soles, comprará golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, etc, para venderlos en su kiosco escolar, trabaja sola en su negocio, su esposo trabaja de chofer.

Su sueño de la señora es tener una empresa de carros para servicio y tener su tienda grande de golosinas, le gusta del Banco Comunal las reuniones, la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Eulalia, 32, is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima community bank in Juli, a district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno.  She is married and has three children, all in school.

Eulalia has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for more than eleven years.  She used her first loan, for S/.300.00 new soles, to support her retail business.  She sells traditional crafts, e.g., bed coverings and embroidered cloth, as well as food snacks.  

Eulalia is applying for a S/.1200 new soles loan that she will use to buy snacks, soft drinks, cookies, chocolates, etc. for the kiosk business she operates at a local school.  She operates the business by herself.  Her husband is a cab driver.

She wants to start a new business servicing ["carros"--could be cars or wheeled carts] and expand her snacks business.  What she most likes about the community bank are the meetings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her kiosk business.

loans.name: Patricia Helena

texts.es:
Patricia vive en el municipio de Amaga en el suroeste Antioqueño con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos, es propietaria de un almacén donde vende artículos para dama, caballeros y niños, además de vender utensilios y uniformes escolares en las temporadas. 

Patricia dice sentir ventaja, con su negocio por ser la única que vende los uniformes de las escuelas y colegios del municipio de Amaga,  y manifiesta que aunque en ocasiones se le dificulta cobrar su cartera por trabajar sola, esta es totalmente recuperable. 

Actualmente Patricia necesita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercancía y surtido para su negocio en especial para la época de navidad que ya se acerca, y con esto podrá amortiguar los pedidos con sus proveedores, mejorar sus ventas, sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Patricia lives in the Amaga, a town in southeastern Antioqueno.  She lives with her husband and their two children.  She owns a store where she sells clothing for men, women and children.  She also sells school uniforms and other school supplies at the time of year when they are most in demand.  

Patricia says that she is lucky because her business is the only one in town that sells school uniforms.  She adds that she always muddles through even though she sometimes finds it difficult to cover all of her expenses.  

Patricia needs a loan to buy new merchandise and stock her business for the coming Christmas season.  The loan will allow her to mollify her suppliers, increase her sales and, in turn, improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay her suppliers and stock her store for Christmas.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene  50  años de edad, es conviviente y tiene diez hijos, 4 de ellos independientes.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace más de once años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales, venta de combustible y venta de abarrotes.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles dinero que incrementará al capital de su negocio y comprará un cilindro de combustible (petróleo y gasolina).  Su esposo trabaja en el sector de educación.

La señora desea tener un carro cisterna para traer combustible, lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la orientación respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Eva, 50, is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima community bank in Juli, a district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno.  She is partnered and has ten children, 4 of whom are grown.

Eva has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for more than eleven years.  She used her first loan, for S/.300.00 new soles, to support her retail business.  She sells all kinds of merchandise: traditional crafts, cylinders of oil and gas for cooking and heating, and groceries.  

Eva is applying for a S/.1500 new soles loan that she will use to buy cylinders of oil and gas for cooking and heating.  Her husband works in education.

Eva would like to buy a vehicle for transporting oil and gas cylinders.  What she most likes about the community bank is its focus on helping businesses.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Carmen Lucrecia

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmen es socia del banco comunal Poloma, vive por una comunidad  que se encuentra en la parroquia del Valle (Cuenca), lugar que se caracteriza por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son personas muy carismáticas y amables quienes se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Doña Carmen tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos de 13, 10, 8, 6, 4, 2 años de edad y su ultimo hijo es un bebé de 3 meses de edad, sus 4 primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora Carmen se dedica a la agricultura, ella  siembra hortalizas y verduras las cuales vende y también son para el consumo de su hogar. También trabaja en una casa de la ciudad como empleada domestica pero solo días que le llaman. En su casa se dedica también al negocio de cría y venta de cuyes y gallinas y es negociante de todo tipo de granos.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de granos para la venta y alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the community bank Poloma, she lives in a neighborhood located in Parroquia del Valle, Cuenca; known for its beautiful landscapes, its people keep the culture and tradition of the town, they are friendly and kind, their main activities are trade, farming and many work in the city doing different activities.

Carmen is 33, married and has seven children ages 13,10,8,6,4,2 and 3 months, the older four go to the community school.  Her husband works in agriculture, they live in a house they own.
 
Carmen works in agriculture, she grows vegetables and sells them and also cooks with them at home.  She also works as a maid in a house in the city, but she only works there on a casual basis when they call her.  At home she also grows and sells chicken and guinea pigs, she also trades a wide variety of grain.

This is her second loan with the community bank and is going to invest it in buying grains to sell them, and also to feed her animals.
 
Her goal is to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy grains to sell them, and also to feed her animals.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 46 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Cuenta con estudios secundarios.
Sonia recientemente se incorpora a trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicita un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en su negocio de venta de combustible y gaseosa.
En sus ratos libres realiza bordados en bayeta (tela) y los vende a sus clientes, su esposo trabaja como transportista.
Su deseo es mejorar el negocio, lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima communal bank located in Juli district, in the province of Chucuito in Puno department. She is 46 years old, lives with her partner and has a son. She has a secondary school education. 

Sonia recently began to work with Movimiento Manuela Ramos and is requesting a loan of 300 nuevos soles, which she will invest in her business selling fuel and soft drinks.

In her free time she makes embroidered cloths and sells them to her customers. Her husband works as a trucker.

Her wish is to improve her business. What she likes about the communal bank is the ease in obtaining a loan.

loans.use: to buy fuel and soft drinks.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es: La señora  pascuala, nacida en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, no es casada pero convive con el señor Humberto con el cual tienen 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  viven en la comunidad de brecha 7 del municipio de la Guardia ( carretera a Camiri), ellos se dedican a  la agricultura desde hace 8 años,  en esta ocasión ellos solicitan un crédito para la compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz y maní en la parcela familiar que pertenece a su padre El Sr. Damacio, la Sra. Pascuala esta  muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Pascuala was born in the city of Santa Cruz. She is not married but lives with her partner, Humberto. They have three children who are all school-aged. They live in the Brecha 7 community in the city of Guardia (on the highway to Camiri). They have been farmers for eight years. At this time, they are requesting a loan to purchase seeds to plant corn and peanuts in the family plot which belongs to her father, Damacio. Pascuala is very grateful for the support provided by the institution.

loans.use: buy seeds for planting corn and peanuts.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene  25  años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos.  La señora estudió hasta la secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, invirtió en su negocio venta de artesanía en bordados y compra y venta de ganados.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco ovinos para su engorde, la señora cuenta que los animales los compra en las ferias de la zona. Su esposo trabaja como albañil. 

Ella desea tener una casa grande y tener una tienda de abarrotes. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las charlas respecto al negocio.

En la foto se muestra junto a su pequeño hijo
texts.en:
Veronica is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima communal bank in Juli district, Chucuito province, in the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, lives with her partner and has two children. She studied until secondary school.

She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan for 300 nuevos soles was invested in her business selling embroidered handicrafts and the purchase and sale of livestock.

With her new loan of 1,000 nuevo soles, she will buy five sheep to fatten. She buys the animals at the markets in the area. Her husband works as a bricklayer.

Sra. Veronica wants to have a large house and a general store. What she enjoys about the communal bank are the meetings and the talks about business.

The photo shows her together with her small son.

loans.use: to buy five sheep to fatten.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo de 47 años, casado con Alejandra de 48 años que fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el centro poblado de puerto amargura, LLochegua. Para él no le fue fácil tener un campo agrícola, pero gracias a su empeño lo consiguio, ahí cultiva y cosecha Cacao y Café. Por lo general, trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de cosecha es donde más ayuda requiere, es por eso que contrata peones para que le faciliten en la extracción de su producto. Su jornada de trabaja empieza desde las 7:30 AM hasta las 6:00 PM, asimismo sus productos son vendidos en los centros de acopio de su comunidad, y éstos varian de acuerdo a la cantidad que entrega a sus compradores. Para el futuro, desea ampliar la siembra de cacao injertado, ya que estos dan un fruto de mayor proporción. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Teofilo esta feliz y contento por el grupo que tiene, por que  son consecuentes con sus objetivos. Con los 2,000 soles que solicita, contratará peones para limpiar sus plantas de cacao, asimismo comprar más plantas de cacao injertada para sembrarlas.
texts.en:
Teofilo, 47, is married to Alejandra, 48, and they have four children.  Together they live in their own house, located in the town of Puerto Amargura, Llochegua.

It wasn't easy for him to have farmland, but thanks to his determination he got it.  He grows and harvests cacao and coffee.  Generally he works alone, but during the harvest he needs more help so he hires farmworkers to help him remove his products.  His work day begins at 7:30 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  He sells his products in the warehouses of his community, which vary according to how much he delivers to his buyers.

In the future he hopes to increase his planting of grafted cacao, since it yields a crop of greater proportion.  This will be his second loan with MFP, and he is committed to making his payments punctually.

Teofilo is happy and contented with the group he has because they are consistent with their goals.

With the 2000 PEN he is requesting he will hire farmworkers to clear his cacao plants and buy more grafted cacao plants to plant.

loans.use: to buy more grafted cacao plants.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Wilson de 31 años, esta casado con Norma de 25 años, fruto de esa relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en el centro poblado de Puerto Amargura, LLochegua. Wilson, es una persona que se caracteriza por tener buenos principios. Él se dedica a la actividad agrícola, cultivando cacao y frutas cítricas, actividad que lo viene ejerciendo durante más de 14 años. En un incio no le fue fácil, ya que los productos que cultivaba tenía un costo alto, pero paulatinamente mejoraron las cosas. Generalmente trabaja con su querida esposa, pero en épocas de cosecha siempre contrata a los peones, quienes son los encargados de recolectar los frutos para luego secarlo y venderlo en su propia localidad. Él está feliz por la buena producción que tiene gracias a la dedicación constante en sus plantaciones. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles comprará un motor para su maquina, que se encarga de sacar la maleza de su campo agrícola.
texts.en: Wilson is 31 years old, is married to Norma who is 25 years old.  They have 3 children.  Together they live in the city center of Puerto Amargura, Llochegua.  Wilson is a person known for his good principles.  He is a farmer, growing cocoa and citrus fruit.  He has been doing this for 14 years.  In the beginning it was not easy since the crops that he grows were expensive, gradually, however,  things improved.  He normally works with his loving wife, but during harvest he employs workers who are the ones that pick the fruit, which is later dried and sold at his own outlet.  He is happy with the production that he has achieved through the constant care that he gives to his crops.  This is his second loan with MFP which he promises to repay on time.  With the 2,000 soles he will buy a motor for his machine that takes the weeds out of his fields.

loans.use: to buy a motor for the machine that removes the weeds from his fields.

loans.name: Wilfredo Dante

texts.es:
El Señor Wilfredo tiene 40 años de edad y vive en Tarija. Wilfredo es casado con la señora Celsa  de 37 años de edad con quien tiene 4 hijos. Wilfredo se dedica a realizar trabajos en su metalurgica que tiene  y su esposa se dedica a la venta de alimentos. Ambos vienen desarrollando sus actividades desde hace muchisimos años.                                                                                            
Wilfredo tiene la nesecidad de comprar material de trabajo para desempeñar su actividad. Es por eso que la presente solicitud es para la compra de mas material, para de este modo poder incrementar sus ingresos familiares.                                                                                                     El esta muy agradecido por el credito que obtuvo con anterioridad, pero la demanda de requerimiento de productos es mayor por lo ha solicitado nuevamente un credito para la compra de materiales para la metalurgia.
texts.en: Wilfredo is 40 years old and lives in Tarija.  He is married to Celsa who is 37 years old and they have four children.  Wilfredo is a blacksmith and his wife works in food sales.  Both have developed their businesses over many years.  Wilfredo needs to purchase material to do his work.  The purpose of the current loan request is to buy more material and increase his productivity and family income.  He is grateful for the previous loan he received.  However, demand for his products is greater and so he is requesting another loan to buy materials for his blacksmith business.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as iron for his blacksmith business.

loans.name: Angela Ramona

texts.es: Ángela de 58 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos, ella habita en Subtiava uno de los barrios mas populares de la ciudad de León, ella es comerciante lo ha sido desde muy joven. Su primer negocio fue la venta de queso ella vendía en el mercado. Su familia siempre la ha elogiado por sabor de su comida y le sugirieron a ella que pusiera una comideria ella así lo hizo puso su negocio. Le ha ido muy lleva 15 años con esta actividad poniéndole su toque de sabor y sazón a sus comidas. Comercializa su comida en el mercado de la estación de Buses de León. Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, verduras, queso, productos lácteos ya que estos son parte de los ingredientes que utiliza para realizar sus deliciosos platillos, que por cierto son muy apetecidos por los clientes. Con esta inversión lograra comprar mas barato estos ingredientes y no sufrir constantemente la alzas de precios en estos productos.  Doña Ángela nos expresa que le gustaría en lo futuro mejorar las condiciones de su establecimiento. Por lo pronto esta ahorrando para comprar un exhibidor de comidas.
texts.en: Angela is 58 years old, married and mother to 2 children.  She lives in Subtiava, one of the more popular areas of León.  She is a merchant, something that she has been doing from very young.  Her first business was the sale of cheese which she sold at the market.  Her family has always praised her for the good taste of her food and suggested that she open a diner.  She has done that and it has been doing very well.  She has been in this business for 15 years, adding her personal touches and seasonings to her food.  She sells her food in the market at the bus station of León.  She is requesting the loan to be able to buy rice, beans, oil, vegetables, cheese, dairy products because these are the ingredients of her delicious dishes which are very appealing to her customers.  With this investment she will be able to buy these products more cheaply and not have to constantly suffer the price increases on these items.  Doña Ángela would like in the future to improve the conditions of her establishment.  She is currently saving for the purchase of a case to display her food.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, vegetables, cheese, dairy products as these are the ingredients of her delicious dishes.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: La familia del Sr. Jose Luis se dedica al comercio informal, el se encuentra casado desde hace diez años, ellos viven al  nor- este de la ciudad, y en relación de la ubicación de sus puesto de mercado donde venden ellos,  es al otro lado de la ciudad ellos no tienen hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, ya que son mayores de edad, debido a que el señor tuvo un accidente el señor Jose Luis tuvo cerrar  el negocio durante un buen tiempo ya que la esposa lo atendía a su esposo internado en el hospital y la mercadería que ellos tenían se fue deteriorando ya que ellos venden champuses y otros productos de limpieza, asi perdieron su capital de trabajo es por este motivo que ellos necesitan el préstamo para poder reactivar su negocio y así poder volver a trabajar ya que ellos son mayores y no pueden trabajar en otras cosas hasta que el señor Jose Luis se recupere del todo de su accidente.
texts.en:
José Luis' family work in the 'informal business' sector.  José has been married for ten years and lives in the north-east of the city.  The market stall from which he sells his products is located on the other side of the city.  He does not have any dependent children as his children are all grown up. 

José Luis suffered an accident and so he had to close his business for a long period of time.  His wife cared for him while he was in the hospital and the merchandise that the couple had became spoiled as they sell shampoo and other personal care products.  This meant that they lost their working capital.  They need this loan so that they can restart their business and go back to work because they are getting on in years and can't work on anything new until José Luis recovers completely from his accident.

loans.use: to have working capital for his business selling personal care products

loans.name: 03.11.07 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hằng has a retail business selling office supplies. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase office supplies for resale.

Hằng is 41 years old and is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 7 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties she faces is the lack of capital. With the profit from her business, Hằng hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more office supplies to resell

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is married with six children. She is born on April 19,1947. She is now 64 years old. She lives in Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living Venancia owns and operates agricultural business raising vegetables for sale. During her harvest she sells different kinds of vegetables( string beans, squash and others)in the market.She has been in this business for more than 3 years. Each month, she earns 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work.

Venancia has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

In, 2010 Venancia join GDMPC. She has been a member of GDMPC for a year . She hopes that her business will expand and to sustain family basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married. She is 45 years old with 5 children and she lives in Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur.

Lolita manages her own business venture, selling fish to make a living for her family. She has handled this business for more than 11 years. Each month she earns 6,000 PHP doing this kind of work. She has requested a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy more materials for fishing and to purchase more fish to sell.

Lolita has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. She will keep the returns for her family's daily needs and for the educational plan of her kids. She's hoping that her business will be blessed by the Lord until all her children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy more materials for fishing and to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Amie Rose

texts.en:
Amie Rose is married with 4 children. She is 34 years old, residing in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Amie Rose operates a retail business, home products sales, to earn a living and has had this business for more than 6 years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. 

Amie Rose has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. She will use the returns from her business to sustain the needs of her family and for the educational plan of her 4 kids. She is hoping that her business will help them so much. In the future, Amie Rose wishes that her business will progress.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a 26-year-old single man. He is the second child in his family. He has four siblings. They are living with their parents except the first child who is living on another island.
 
Winfred has been working as a fishmonger for 7 years. He commenced the business using his own small capital. He usually gets up at 3 am to buy fish and then walks from one house to another to sell the fish. From the business income, Winfred has been able to buy a used motorbike that helps him in running the business.

After running the business for seven years, one day Winfred was thinking to be a fisherman but he needs a small boat (a kind of canoe) to do so. Therefore, he is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He would like to purchase a small boat, trawl, tarpaulin and a lamp as well. He is hoping TLM will approve the loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase a small boat, trawl, tarpaulin and a lamp as well.

loans.name: Johny

texts.es:
Ser reconocido como una persona responsable y trabajadora, así como brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos son los sueños de Johny, quien se dedica al transporte de materiales en su moto desde Rionegro a la Ceja, municipios del oriente de Antioquia, lo que le permite obtener sus propios ingresos. 

Actualmente este emprendedor de 33 años de edad, necesita de un préstamo para reparar su moto y así brindar un servicio más rápido y oportuno lo que se traducirá en mayores ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Johny's dreams are to be recognized as a responsible and hard-working person, and to provide his children with a good education.  Johny's business is transporting goods on his motorbike from Rionegro to La Ceja, towns in the east of Antioquia.  This allows him to make his own income.

This 33-year-old entrepreneur currently needs a loan to repair his motorcycle so that he can provide a faster and more timely service.  This will allow him to make more income for himself and his family.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Shiela Mae

texts.en: Shiela Mae is single. She is 28 years old, residing in Taboo, Jimenez Misamis Occidental. Shiela Mae owns and operates farm land, planting crops to earn a living. She has handled this business for more than 4 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pay costs for planting rice. Shiela Mae has been a member a GDMPC for almost one year and it's her first cycle loan. In the future, Shiela Mae hopes that her business will grow more salable and her income will be doubled to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay costs for rice planting

loans.name: María Rubiela

texts.es:
A sus 47 años de edad María Rubiela es una emprendedora incansable que desde muy joven se dedica a la confección y aunque inició realizando arreglos ahora confecciona diferentes prendas, especialmente uniformes y aunque sólo cuenta con una máquina de coser que en algunas oportunidades le falla, esto no ha sido impedimento para que continúe trabajando por el bienestar de su familia conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijas. 

María Rubiela necesita de un préstamo para comprar las telas necesarias para la temporada escolar que se aproxima y así cumplirle a sus clientes con los pedidos.
texts.en:
At 47 years of age, María Rubiela is a tireless entrepreneur who has been making clothes since she was very young.  Although she started out altering clothes, she now works making different garments, especially uniforms.  Although she only has one sewing machine which sometimes lets her down, this hasn't been an obstacle to her continuing to work for the well-being of her family (her husband and two daughters).  

María Rubiela needs a loan to buy the fabric she needs for the upcoming back-to-school season.  This will allow her to fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Jason

texts.en: Jason is married with one kid. He is 25 years old, residing in Poblacion Panaon, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Jason operates his own motor cab in his barangay (village). He has had this business for more than 4 years. Each month, he earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of work. Jason has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and for maintenance. Jason has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, he hopes to finish educating his child.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and for maintenance

loans.name: Dorjderem

texts.en:
Borrower Dorjderem is a 31-year-old man who lives with his family in an outer ger district without basic infrastructure in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He has a son and daughter, aged 3 and 9, and an elder son who attends a local secondary school. Dorjderem’s spouse supports her family by running a taxi business. 

Since 1998, when he graduated high school, he has been working in border troops general staff. Therefore, Dorjderem is very experienced with border troops. The family lives in a worn-out small ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, and it’s quite uncomfortable to live in with his family. Therefore, he decided to build a new small house on his own land plot, where fundamental work is already done. Today, he can’t finish his housing project because he doesn't have enough money to purchase essential construction materials. 

So he is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase necessary construction materials, such as wood, paint, over proof, etc. He wants to finish the construction project before December, since winter temperatures in Mongolia finish off at minus 400 degrees. Thereupon, Dorjderem desires to make a better and cozy living condition for his family.
 
To run a taxi is very difficult for women and Dorjderem builds his house alone without any help from others. It proves that both Dorjderem and his wife are real hardworking people.

loans.use: to purchase necessary construction materials

loans.name: Blanca Nidia

texts.es:
Después de trabajar para algunos familiares en diferentes negocios, decidió crear su propia tienda de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, una de las ventajas de su tienda es que ésta se encuentra ubicada en su casa, lo que le ha permitido estar al frente de sus tres hijos para brindarles mayor atención. 

teniendo en cuenta que se aproxima la temporada de fin de año, Blanca necesita de un préstamo para comprar diferentes productos que le permitan mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
After having worked for some of her family members in different businesses, Blanca decided to set up her own store selling basic household products.  One of the advantages of her store is that it is located in her home.  This allows her to look after her children and provide them with more attention.

Bearing in mind the fact that the end of the year is approaching, Blanca needs a loan to buy different products which will allow her to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
A sus 69 años de edad, Luis Alberto trabaja desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde en los oficios propios de la construcción en Medellín, al lado de su hijo y otras tres personas, este luchador se dedica a esta labor desde hace 30 años. 

Para continuar realizando su labor de una manera más eficiente, Luis Alberto necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunas herramientas como esmeril y equipo de pintura pues los que tiene ya no le prestan un buen servicio debido a su antigüedad.
texts.en: At the age of 69, Luis Alberto works from 6am until 6pm in construction jobs in Medellín alongside his son and three other people.  This hardworking man has been in this line of work for 30 years.  To continue doing his work more efficiently, Luis Alberto needs to buy some tools like emery and painting equipment because the ones he has aren’t working too well anymore because of their age.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
This is Pacita, 54, a resident of Dasmarinas Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Melanio, a farmer, and father to her two children. Both children are already working. Pacita, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Pacita operates a river spinach farm. She grows river spinach, or kangkong in our native language, in a rented vacant lot located in Cavite. River spinach is easy to maintain and it grows where there's a lot of water. The tender hollow stems of kangkong, as well as its leaves, are used in cooking. It can be stir-fried, steamed, boiled or lightly fried in oil. Pacita sells her product to market stalls that she regularly supplies and to the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help continue operations of her business, Pacita is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Pacita dreams of having her own piece of land for their business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some piglets for raising

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El negocio de venta de frutas y verduras de José Antonio es familiar, puesto que en él trabaja su esposa y su cuñado con quien también comparten su casa para poder entre todos cubrir los gastos familiares. A sus 34 años de edad, este emprendedor espera en el futuro ampliar su negocio y ofrecer otros productos de la canasta familiar, así como carnes. 

Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas como pintar y mejorar las estanterías donde ubican los productos y comprar algunas frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
José Antonio's business selling fruits and vegetables is a family business, since his wife and brother-in-law work there.  They also share their home with his brother-in-law to be able to cover all the family expenses between them.

At 34 years of age, this entrepreneur hopes to expand his business in the future to offer other food products, such as meats.

Currently he needs a loan to make some changes in his place, such as painting and improving the shelving where they put the products, and to buy some fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to make changes in his place and to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married with 5 children. She was born on December 27, 1981. She is now 30 years old and resides in Tinotongan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She owns and operates a service-based business specialized in operating a motorcycle transport locally known as "habal-habal". 

To earn a living Alma provides a motorcycle transport services in the local community. Alma has had this business for more than 5 years and earns 5,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this type of activity.

Alma has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She has been a member of GDMPC for more than 3 years. She plan to buy another motorcycle for transport to earn more for the education of her children

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Patricia Elena

texts.es:
El deseo de salir adelante y de contribuir en su hogar conformado por su esposo y sus tres hijos, hcieron que Patricia Elena aprendiera el oficio de la confección viendo realizarlo a otras personas, desde entonces viene realizando algunas prenda, así como decoraciones navideñas. 

Esta emprendedora de 33 años de edad, necesita de un préstamo para comprar telas, hilos y adornos para algunas decoraciones que realizará pues se aproxima la temporada navideña. Así podrá ofrecerle a sus clientes diferentes alternativas e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The wish to get ahead and contribute to her home composed of her husband and three children caused Patricia Elena to learn dressmaking with the aim of doing it for others.  Since then, she’s been making clothes as well as Christmas decorations.

This enterprising 33-year-old needs a loan to buy fabric, thread and decorative items to make some Christmas decorations for the approaching season to offer her customers different choices and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and docorative items.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma, aged 43 and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Vicente, a businessman, and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. Together they work hard to secure the future of their family.

Gemma operates a meat-processing business. She buys meat and processes it to produce products such as tocino (cured pork), giniling (ground pork), and longganisa (sweet sausage), which she sells to the community. She has many patrons who buy her processed meat and then sell it at their market stalls. There are many patrons who prefer Gemma’s products since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. Gemma's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy meat and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Gemma hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for meat products and other ingredients needed in her meat processing business.

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es:
Los problemas D. orden público que se han vivido en el barrio D. Medellín en el que vive Blanca Luz no han sido impedimento para que siga adelante con su negocio D. alquiler D. lavadoras que desempeña desD. hace algún tiempo con la colaboración D. uno D. sus 4 hijos. 

En el futuro esta emprendedora sueña con un espacio más amplio que le permita tener más lavadoras y generar empleo a personas D. la zona y para lograrlo poco a poco, por ahora necesita D. un préstamo para comprar 3 lavadoras lo que le permitirá ofrecer sus servicios a más personas y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Public order problems in the neighborhood of Medellín in which Blanca Luz lives haven't stopped her from getting ahead in her business renting washing machines.  She has been in this business for some time, together with one of her four children.

In the future, this entrepreneur dreams of having more space which will allow her to have more washing machines and create work for people from her area.  Right now, she needs a loan to buy three washing machines which will allow her to offer her services to more people and thereby improve her income.

loans.use: to buy washing machines

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
From a rented booth in a suburban market, Mr. Phan is selling different kinds of fish with his wife. His products are fresh, dried, and smoked fish. Phan is now 29 years old and he has been in the fish selling business since 2005. This business earns him a good profit; he typically generates approximately $5.00 per day. Phan has planned to grow his business significantly in the next few years and buy more inventory of fish and as well as household products for sale. From that, he’ll be able to create more income for his family because many people are getting to know him and his products in the market. 

In order to achieve his goal, Phan decided to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy more stock of fish for sale. This is Phan’s second loan form Kiva and he never made a late payment on his previous loan. He is very happy and thankful that all lenders continue assisting him in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish for sale.

loans.name: Ryan Jay

texts.en:
Ryan Jay is married with 2 kids. He is 28 years old and he is from Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is a fisherman. His picture is taken when he was in the office applying for a financial assistance. He comes from the market to sell his fish with his contract buyer.He owns and operates a business in the food sector, selling his own caught fish to earn a living.  He has had this business for more than 8 years and earns 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this type of work.

Ryan Jay has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy a new engine for his pump-boat and to purchase fish for resale. He has been a member of GDMPC for 3 years. In the future, he will use his returns to provide for the needs of his family and to educate his two kids.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his pump-boat and to purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Adriana Patricia

texts.es:
Desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche, Adriana Patricia abre su tienda de productos de la canasta familiar que tiene desde hace 8 meses, después de dedicarse durante años a las ventas ambulantes. Esta emprendedora sueña con tener una tienda muy bien surtida. 

Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido como fríjol, maíz, panela, arroz, entre otros productos que le permitirán mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: From 8 in the morning until 9 at night, Adriana Patricia opens her grocery store that she’s had for the last 8 months after having been a street vendor for years.  This entrepreneur dreams with having a very well stocked store.  She needs a loan at present to buy stock items like beans, corn, cheese and rice, among others in order to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Miriam Cecilia

texts.es:
Con el propósito de contribuir a cubrir los gastos del hogar, Miriam Cecilia se dio a la tarea de empezar a confeccionar y empezó realizando algunas prendas para sus familiares, con el tiempo, empezó a realizarle prendas a sus vecinos y conocidos hasta convertir este oficio en su propio negocio, el cual desempeña desde su casa. 

A sus 49 años de edad, esta emprendedora espera crear un almacén donde pueda ofrecer sus diseños. Por ahora necesita de un préstamo para comprar telas e insumos para elaborar prendas para la temporada navideña, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
With the objective of contributing to household expenses, Miriam Cecilia started sewing and making a few items of clothing for her relatives.  In time, she started to make them for neighbors and acquaintances until she turned this occupation into a business of her own which she carries out at home.

At the age of 49, this enterprising woman hopes to create a store where she can sell her designs.  For now, she needs a loan to buy fabric and supplies to make articles of clothing for the Christmas season which will allow her to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, 47, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Dol, a consultant, and is the mother to three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses and to support her children’s schooling

Arlene operates a Thermal Paper and Chlorine distribution business. There is more need now for services like these in their area as customer demand has increased. She gets supplies at wholesale prices and sells by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of 900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for her business. She will also invest a portion of the loan in a new stall. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Arlene dreams of being able to give all her children a good, high quality education through her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As a responsible mother, Elma engages in selling frozen foods in her village to help her husband gain income. They plan to strengthen their sources of income to be able to support the education of their three children. They want the children to finish their studies so that they will find good jobs someday. Despite problems and difficulties they encountered in life, Elma and her husband are striving hard to support their family. 

Elma wants to ask for an additional capital of PHP 9,000 to buy hot dogs, longaniza (pork sausage), tocino, and boneless fish to sell. She mentioned that this loan will be a great help for her to improve her business. She believes that her patience and sacrifices will make her business grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, longaniza (pork sausage), tocino, and boneless fish to sell

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар умная и честная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Более 8 лет она занимается скотоводством и имеет хорошего опыта в данном бизнесе. Она хочет содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и устроит своих детей в хороших школах. Диловар хотела бы получить займ в размере 1300 Сомони для покупки скота для того чтобы бизнес расширился и она получила желаемой прибыли. Диловар заранее благодарит вас за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Dillovar is a clever and honest woman. She is married and the loving mother of three children. For more than eight years, she has raised cattle and has gained extensive experience in this business. She wants to ensure good living conditions for her family and place her children into good schools. Dilovar would like a loan of 1,300 TJS to buy animals, so that she can grow her business and achieve her target income. Dilovar thanks you in advance for your help and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to grow her business

loans.name: Zebojon

texts.ru: Более 8 лет Зебоджон занимается купля продажей скота. Она замужем и у них двое детей. Зебоджон трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. Она любит свою работу и с удовольствием продолжает свое дело. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. Зебоджон запрашивает займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Она заранее благодарна всем за помощь и понимание. Мы нуждаемся в вашу поддержку! Спасибо вам!
texts.en: For more than eight years, Zebojon has bought and sold cattle. She is married and has two children. Zebojon is a hard-working, responsible woman. She loves her work, and is eager to continue with her business. She wants to expand her business and maximise profits. Zebojon is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy more cattle, with the goal of growing her business. She is thankful for everyone's help and understanding. We need your support! Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase animals

loans.name: Urunzhon

texts.ru: Урунжон любящая жена и в воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Она любит свою семью и хочет помогать мужу на содержании семьи, и с этой целью открыла свой бизнес. Более 4 года она занимается купля продажей продукты питания. У неё в магазине не большой ассортимент продуктов и она хочет, добавит широкий ассортимент продуктов в своем магазине, чтобы клиенты могли найти свои нужные продукты. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 2500 Сомони. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Urunzhon is a loving woman, and is raising one child. She loves her husband and her child and wants to help with financial support for the family. With this goal in mind, she opened her business. For more than four years, she has run a grocery store. Presently, her store does not have a very wide selection of products, so she would like to present a wider range of products to her customers, enabling them to find the products they need. For this purpose, she is seeking a loan of 2,500 TJS. She is grateful for your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for retail

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is married with one kid. She is 45 years old and resides in Colupa Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Esterlita owns & operates a farm, planting crops to earn a living. She has had this business for more than five years. Each month, she earns Php 1,000.00. She is a responsible and goal-oriented person. She has requested a loan of Php 5,000.00 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. Esterlita has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. In the future, Esterlita hopes to double the income from this business and to complete her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Khongorzul

texts.en:
The lady shown in this picture is a 23-year-old young entrepreneur named Khongorzul, who lives with her spouse and daughter in a ger - a traditional Mongolian felt tent - in an outer ger district (a district without basic infrastructure) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her daughter attends a local kindergarten while Khongorzul’s husband runs a taxi business. 

Khongorzul has been operating a clothing sale business since 2007 at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. When she first started her business, it was very difficult for her, but she was patient. Now, she has 2.7 million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) in working capital. Also, she imports her jackets once or twice a month from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. Using her business profit, she bought a car for her spouse last June so her husband drives a taxi and sometimes helps her to operate the business. 

Khongorzul and her spouse’s wish is to own a plot of land and real estate. Therefore, they need money to purchase more jackets to sell. So she is requesting a 1 million MNT loan to import jackets and suits from Ereen city.

loans.use: to import more jackets to sell

loans.name: Rafo

texts.ru: Рафо более 11 лет занимается изготовлением национальных курпачи и матрасов, а также шитьем узоров на наволочках. Когда её муж открыл цех по выпуску напитков, она ему помогала. Затем она самостоятельно открыло свой цех по шитьем матрасов, и она приняла на работу сестру и дочку. Они втроем по заказу шьют. Жители которые хотят сыграть свадьбу заказывает им курпачу. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки ваты и тканей для шитьем курпачи и национальных матрасов.
texts.en: Rafo has worked for more than eleven years making kurpachas (traditional velvet rugs) and mattresses, and embroidering pillow cases. She also helped her husband when he opened a beverage factory. After that, she opened her own workshop to sew mattresses, hiring her daughter and her sister. The three of them do custom work for clients. Customers who are planning weddings go to them to place orders for kurpachas. Rafo would like a loan of 3,000 TJS to purchase cotton and fabric to sew kurpachas and mattresses.

loans.use: to purchase cotton and fabrics

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира любящая жена и заботливая мать 4 детей. Она начала продавать детские и женские одежды 12 лет тому назад, когда её муж не работал. Она ездила в город и привезла товар в малом количестве, а потом получила займ от «Имон Интернэшнл» и начала работать с займом, чтобы увеличить свой товарооборот. И так она расширила свой бизнес и сейчас имеет свою торговую точку. Её торговая точка находиться в центре рынка. Также её муж устроился на работу, а теперь работает главным технологом на химзаводе. Её дети выросли, и её сын уехал в России на заработках и ежемесячно отправляет денежные переводы на стройку дома. Она хотела бы получит займ для покупки детских и женских товаров на зимний период.
texts.en: Munira is a loving wife and caring mother of four children. She started selling children's and women's clothes twelve years ago, when her husband did not have work. She travelled into the city and brought small quantities of goods. Later, she received a loan from IMON International and used the money for her business, increasing turnover. Thus she expanded her business and now has her own retail area in the center of the market. Her husband has also found work as the head technologist at a chemical factory. Her children have grown up, and her son has gone to Russia for work, sending money back every month for construction of a house. Munira would like a loan to purchase children's and women's clothes for the winter season.

loans.use: to purchase women's and children's winter clothing

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en:
Bolor-Erdene is the 42-year-old mother of three sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in a small house in the outer ger (Mongolian traditional tent) district of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. This district is without basic infrastructure. Her elder son lives and works in Japan, and her daughter got married and went to live with her husband, so today Bolor-Erdene lives with her spouse and two sons, who attend local university and kindergarten, while their father is a contracted employee in Korea.

She supports her family by operating a business selling men's jackets in the largest outer market of Mongolia. She has been operating this business since 1994, so she is a very experienced entrepreneur. Also, she has 4.6 million Mongolian tugriks (MNT) in working capital. In the winter season, she specializes in selling handmade men’s coats. 

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase raw materials from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. She will use these materials to sew handmade coats.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to sew handmade coats

loans.name: Nyawa

texts.en:
Nzaphila is a widowed man with 3 children who are enrolled in school. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and medical bills.

Nzaphila has operated a clothes selling business for the past 7 years; his potential clients are his neighbors and the local residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality when there is high demand during the festive season. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase more clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jonibek

texts.ru: Чонибек женат имеет двоих детей. Семья молодая. Жена работает учительницей. Содержать семью в городе очень трудно. Цены высокие, расходы большие. Вот и стал Чонибек заниматься бизнесом-продажей женских тканей. Стартовый капитал он взял у своей тети. Для получения большего дохода и пополнения товарооборота он хочет получить займ и расширить свой бизнес. Он надеется на ваше великодушие и поддержку.
texts.en: Jonibek is married and has two children. They are a young family and his wife works as a teacher. It is difficult to support a family in the city because prices are high and there are many bills to pay. So Jonibek decided to start a business - selling fabric for women's clothing. His aunt provided him with start-up capital. To increase his income and turnover, he wants to apply for a loan to expand his business. He is counting on your generosity and support.

loans.use: purchase goods

loans.name: Bold

texts.en:
Mr. Bold, 58, is a plumber who operates privately. He has been doing his business for 20 years and has gained much experience and dexterity. Now he lives with his wife in their apartment in Kherlen, a town on the Mongolian west boundary. All of his children have already moved out. 
Bold always wants to make adjustments and renovations in his apartment to make it more comfortable. At last he has decided to take a loan to purchase some building and decoration materials to make his planned renovations.

loans.use: To renovate his apartment.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with 7 children, 2 of whom are in school while the rest have completed school. Her husband is a medicine man who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for the children.

Umazi has operated a maize selling business for the past 5 years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where there are no harvests in dry seasons. She dreams of building a house.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bags of maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Bum-Erdene

texts.en:
Bum-Erdene is a 23-year-old young mother and entrepreneur who lives with her spouse and son in a small house in a ger district /district without basic infrastructure/ of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her son attends the local kindergarten while her husband works as an engineer at the trolleybus depot. 

She has been operating a clothing sales business since 2008. She usually sells men's suits, which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. Now she has 3 million MNT/Mongolian Tugriks/ working capital. In the winter season, she sews handmade coats; therefore Bum-Erdene is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase coat materials so she can sew coats for the upcoming season.

loans.use: to purchase coat materials for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with 7 children, 4 of whom are enrolled in school while the others are still too young for school. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Fatuma has operated a retail shop for the past 9 months. Her potential clients are local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil for her shop. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi is a married woman with 3 children who have completed their primary school level. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and medical bills.

Nazi has operated a fried fish selling business for the past 4 years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where there are no fish in the ocean in the cold season. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase more fish and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to be able to get capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Ngao

texts.en:
Ngoa is a married man with 6 children, 2 of whom are enrolled in school, 2 have completed their primary school level, and the other 2 are still too young for school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.

Ngoa has operated a food stall for the past 6 years. His potential clients are his neighbors and friends. He faces a major challenge of the lack of sales sometimes. He dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase wheat flour, beans, sugar, tea leaves and cooking fat for his business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access financial facilities to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, beans, sugar, tea leaves and cooking fat for his business.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru: Мутабар замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Она  трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Её муж уехал в Россию на заработки, чтобы зарабатывать денег на содержание семьи и улучшения свое жилищное условий. Мутабар хотела помочь мужу и решила заняться торговлей. Вот уже более 13 лет она занимается купле - продажей женских тканей. Раньше она ходила по домам, чтобы продавать товар, потом постепенно взяла в аренду торговую точку всего лишь полметра площади на рынке. А теперь расширила бизнес, а также место бизнеса. Мутабар хотела бы получить займ в размере 7000 Сомони для покупки нового ассортимента товаров, чтобы увеличить свой товарооборот.
texts.en: Mutabar is married and is the loving mother of two children. She is a hard-working and honest woman. Her husband left for work in Russia to earn money to support the family and improve their living conditions. Mutabar wanted to help her husband and decided to go into retail. For the past thirteen years she has been trading in fabrics for women's clothing. In the beginning she would go door-to-door to sell her goods, but eventually she was able to rent a space at the market, just half a meter large. Now she has expanded her business and her retail location. Mutabar would like a loan of 7,000 TJS to buy a new selection of goods to increase turnover.

loans.use: to purchase a new selection of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goats for his business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel, 26, is married with two children. She lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zam.del Sur. Maricel owns and operates a farm, planting crops to earn a living. She has had this business for more than two years. Each month she earns Php 10,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of Php 20,000.00 which will be used to purchase fertilizer and pay costs for rice planting. Maricel has been a member of GDMPC for one year and it's her first loan cycle. In the future, Maricel will use the returns to provide for her family and for the education of her two kids.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for rice planting

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with nine children who are all enrolled in school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Kwekwe has operated a business selling clothes for the past three years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business. 

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase more clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to get financial aid to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two computers.

loans.name: Hoji

texts.ru: Хочи занимается растениеводством. Ему 62 года. У него шестеро детей. Он разведен. Его дети живут вместе с ним. Он более 17 лет выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, топлива и семян лука.
texts.en: Hoji cultivates crops. He is 62 years old, and has six children. He is divorced. His children live with him. He has grown vegetables for more than 17 years. He is applying for credit to purchase mineral fertilizers, fuel and onion seeds.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer, fuel, and onion seeds

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga is a loving husband and father of three. He lives in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. His two oldest children live independently and the youngest one is a school student. 

Gantulga started his business making wooden furniture at home in 2002. His furniture is well known for its quality and design. His wife sells his furniture in the market. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says "I have done everything I can to support my children. Now that they are old enough, it is time to concentrate on my business." 

He is requesting 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugrik (MNT) to buy wood, panelling and an oven.

loans.use: to buy wood, panelling and an oven.

loans.name: Vangeline

texts.en:
This is Vangeline, 36, resident of Talon Amadeo Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, a tricycle driver and father to her children. By the grace of God, they are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Vangeline oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community, all of whom pay a daily fee. Vangeline’s husband drives their tricycle. Their regular customers are their neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Vangeline is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of her tricycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Vangeline hopes to expand her business and dreams that through all their hard work in their business their children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of a tricycle.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Нуриддин проживает в районе Рудаки. Он таксист маршрутной линии №3. Ему 61 год. Он женат. У них четверо детей. Нуриддин в этой области три года. До этого он 15 проработал по профессии, инженером. У него имеется высшее образование. Нуриддин берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Nuriddin lives in the region of Rudaki. He is a taxi driver along route №3. He is 61 years old. He is married and has four children. Nuriddin has worked in this field for three years. Before that, he worked as an engineer for 15 years. He has a university degree. Nuriddin is applying for credit to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Doeun

texts.en:
As shown in the picture, Mrs. Doeun is standing with her husband in front of her poor thatch-roofed house. It’s here that she's given birth to three children. Currently, the roof has become fragile because of the weather conditions. Doeun is a local farmer in Prey Chor, Kompong Cham province. Because of the low income she earns from farming, it’s not possible to cover daily costs and provide for the basic necessities of the family. Therefore, her husband and her older son also help in earning more income by working outdoors. They work as construction workers in mobile places with their team of workers.

Doeun has been concerned about her house, which is becoming harder to live in. She wants to reroof her house and fix it partially. That’s why she is taking out a loan from Kiva, through HKL. She hopes that all Kiva’s lenders will help her family.

loans.use: to reroof her house and fix it partially.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 43 years old and married. He has been running a greengrocery in Malindi for the last 14 years with a monthly profit of about KES 15,000.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his second loan of KES 19,500 from KADET LTD, with which he plans to buy assorted fruits and vegetables to sell.

He will save the anticipated profit to provide the basic needs for his family. In future he hopes to grow his business and be stable financially.

loans.use: to buy assorted fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 33 years old. He is married and together they have two children. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last seven years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for mixed farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of dwelling. He has been a good client and this will be his first loan, with which he is planning to buy farm produce like fertilizers and seeds for planting.

He will also use the loan money to prepare land for farming and during weeding.  He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy and build rental premises. He is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Tiaulel

texts.en:
Tiaulel is 36 years old. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she does mixed farming. 

She has been engaged in her farming for over eight years and earns approximately KES 5,000 a month for these activities. She has been a good client and this is her third loan, with which she plans to buy farm supplies including fertilizers and seeds. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is married with five children. She is 53 years old and is from Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Rosa operates her sari-sari (variety) store in their barangay (village) to make a living, and has had this business for more than two years. Each month she earns about Php10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan in the amount of Php 30,000 to purchase more products to sell in their store. Rosa has a been member of GDMPC for almost a year. She wishes that her business will become more progressive. She will use her income for an educational plan for her five kids.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley has been practicing farming in Narok, Kenya for the last eight years. He is 33 years old, married, and supports six people in the family.

He has been a good client and he has applied for his first loan. He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in the region.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds.

loans.name: Isedro

texts.en:
Isedro is 62 years old and is a married man with 4 children. He runs a tricycle taxi business and has had this business for more than 5 years. Isedro also buys and sells fruits and vegetables to the people in his town. 

Isedro is asking for a loan to purchase tricycle spare parts. He hopes to be a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tricycle spare parts.

loans.name: Biktor

texts.en:
Biktor is a 42-year-old farmer from the village of Korbouli in the Imereti region of West Georgia. He lives with his family, which comprises his wife, Marina, his 7-year-old son, and parents. Biktor’s son goes to school.

During the morning hours, Biktor works as a school bus driver. He takes children to school. After the morning, he is busy in the family's agricultural business. Marina works as a teacher in the local school. Biktor’s parents and Marina are also involved in agriculture. The family owns three milk cows. Marina produces cheese, which is sold locally to dairy product retailers. Also, the family grows beans and maize on a family-owned 1.25-hectare parcel of land. About half of the harvested products are sold locally and the rest is used for feeding the cows. Last year, Biktor started a mini sheep farm. He purchased nine lambs and raised them. 

With the requested loan, Biktor plans to purchase 20 sheep. He will sell sheep milk products and lambs. This will significantly increase the income of the family. Biktor plans to reinvest the profit received from sheep breeding in the same business, in order to expand it and make it more profitable for the future.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep for expansion of his small sheep farm

loans.name: Mary
