texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old and married to Daniel. Together they have four children, aged 15, 13, 8 and 5 years old. She is into a recycling business. She buys scrap shoes and plastics for recycling. She has been in the business for the past five years. She gets a monthly income of about KES 20,000 from the business.

This is her second loan term with KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan successfully. She will use this loan amount to purchase scrap rubber soles and plastics in larger quantities for resale. 

She will plow the anticipated profits back into the business. Her dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy rubber and plastics in large quantities.

loans.name: Okpe (Xwlacodji) Group

texts.fr: OKPE(XWLACODJI) est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Clémentine Donsi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans.   Clémentine Donsi est mariée à un électricien du nom de Marcelin. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Clémentine Donsi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Clémentine Donsi a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Clémentine Donsi vend depuis une dizaine d’années, des mèches  par le système de distribution. Parallèlement à cette activité, Clémentine Donsi vend des défrisants pour cheveux et des sous vêtements. Clémentine Donsi s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité, Clémentine Donsi sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe OKPE(XWLACODJI). Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Okpe (Xwlacodji) is a group of three persons, whose members reside in the same area in Benin. The representative of the group, Clementine Donsi (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 38 years old.

Clementine Donsi is married to an electrician named Marcelin. The couple has four children all in school and living under their care. She lives together with her ​​husband and children, and the couple shares responsibility for handling the various household expenses.

Clementine Donsi interrupted her education at high school level. To deal with her various responsibilities, she has been selling hair extensions through the distribution system over the past ten years. In parallel to this activity, she also sells hair straighteners and lingerie. She gets her supplies in Benin and from Togo.

In her quest to satisfy customers and wanting to expand her business, Clementine Donsi, together with other Okpe (Xwlacodji) group members, is requesting a third credit loan from ALIDé. This credit will serve to better meet the demands of their customers and make more profit.

loans.use: Buy hair extensions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Nadutari

texts.en:
Nadutari is a married lady and a mother of three children who depend on her. She has been a farmer in Mau-Narok, Kenya for a period of six years.

She knew about KADET LTD through other women registered in her area of residence. She paid the previous loan successfully without complication. This is her second loan from KADET LTD and she wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is married and 60 years old with 6 children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is operating a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for more than 6 years. Each month, she earns about Php 3,500. She has requested a loan in the amount of Php 5,000 to buy more products to sell. Alicia has been a member of GDMPC for more than one year. In the future she will save the returns for her educational plan for her six kids.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has four children and all of them are currently enrolled in school. Her husband works as a shopkeeper and drives a bus. Jane has operated a general store for the past five years and her primary customers are local residents. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Jane describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expenses to be rent and food. 

Jane will use the loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice, and matchboxes. Jane aspires to run her own wholesale business in the future. She joined Yehu because of their efficiency and transparency.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice, and matchboxes.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells canned goods, bread, chips and other kinds of products. Aside from the sari-sari store, Felicidad also buys and sells sound systems.

Felicidad has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice and soft drinks. She hopes to have a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Alfonsa is 77 years old; she is a widow with six kids and resides at Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. To make a living, Alfonsa raises a garden, and she earns 9,000 Philippines pesos (Php) monthly with this work. 

Alfonsa requested a loan of 12,000 Php to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She's been member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Alfonsa plan to improve their house to live in convenience.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 25 years old and single. He resides in Narok, Kenya. He is a maize farmer. He has been farming for the past eight years. He knew KADET  LTD through a registered client with KADET. 

Benard has been a good client and this is his third loan. He plans to use the loan to prepare the land for farming and buy farm inputs, i.e maize seeds and fertilizers.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to re-invest in other businesses. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to prepare the land for farming and to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 61 years old and married with three children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Nenita has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the variety store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling firewood.

Nenita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 to 7 years old, and 2 are currently enrolled in school. Her husband works as a shopkeeper. Rehema has operated a general store for the past 8 years and her primary customers are local residents. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality, and her highest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Rehema will use the Kes 80,000 loan to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, salt, bars of soap and matchboxes to sell. Rehema aspires to run her own wholesale business in the future. She joined Yehu because the organization empowers small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, salt, bars of soap and matchboxes to sell.

loans.name: Natabelle

texts.en:
Natabelle is 46 years old and married with 3 children. Natabelle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (variety store) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Natabelle has borrowed and re-paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 7 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane, rice retailing, pig fattening and raising goat.

Natabelle aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Choem

texts.en:
Mrs. Choem, 37, is in the business of cultivating rice in Prey Chor, Kompong Cham province. She is married with 4 single children, all of whom live under her care and income. Some of them are at the age for attending school but they are still not enrolled yet because of the family’s condition. The main source of her income comes from her husband who provides a battery charging service to the people in and around the community. He charges KHR1,000 per battery for a bigger battery and KHR5,00 for a smaller one. He’s able to earn an average of $4.00 a day. 

The main core of this business activity is based on how the electric generator works. But unluckily, her previous device is too old and dangerous to use. So Choem decided to request some funds from HKL and Kiva to support her husband's business. She’ll use these funds to buy an electric generator which will allow her husband’s business to further improve in the future. With the increase in her income, she’ll send her children to join a class in a local school next year.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 58 years old and married with 3 children. Estela works very hard to provide for them. Estela runs a personal collections products retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Estela has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as lotion, soap, perfumes, cream, etc. 

In the future Estela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 31 years old and married with 3 children. Vivian works very hard to provide for them. Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store. Vivian has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies. 

Vivian would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maro

texts.en:
Maro is from the village of Breta in the Kartli region of East Georgia. She is 63 years old and lives in the village with her husband Gabriel. The family earns a living through agriculture. They own 1.3 hectares of land, where they grow maize, beans, tomato and onion. Maro and Gabriel sell harvested products locally to green-grocery retailers. Their family's total average monthly income is 540 Laris. 

Maro requested credit for purchasing fuel for a tractor to till the land. As she takes good care of the land, she can count on a good harvest next season. A small part of the credit will also be used for purchasing wood for her oven, as it is the only mean of heating the house during the winter months in Maro’s village.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for a tractor for tilling land and wood for an oven for heating the house

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en: 52-year-old Nicanora is a married woman with three children. She has poultry and makes a living selling eggs. Nicanora has regular customers in her town to whom she delivers eggs. Nicanora requested a loan to purchase eight boxes of egg trays. This will help Nicanora deliver more eggs at one time. Nicanora hopes her business will grow more.

loans.use: to purchase eight boxes of egg trays.

loans.name: Lagrimas

texts.en:
Lagrimas is 36 years old and married with five children.

Lagrimas works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lagrimas has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lagrimas aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Ailyn works hard to support her family.

She has a banana retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from ice cream vending. Ailyn is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of bananas to sell in her business.

Ailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of bananas to sell

loans.name: Nolie

texts.en: Nolie is married with one child. He is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. Nolie is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years. He has requested a loan of 35,000 to purchase fertilizer for the corn plantation. Nolie has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Nolie hopes to send his child to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the corn plantation.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is a 42-year-old widow who lives with her daughter, aged 5, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends kindergarten. Altantsetseg supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

When she first began her business, she had 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) in working capital. Now she has 4,400,000 MNT in working capital. She sells jeans and trousers, which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more jeans to sell in order to increase her jeans and trousers variety.

Her goal is to expand her business and then to be able to improve her daughter’s education.  She is one of our trusted client who is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more jeans to sell

loans.name: Reina

texts.en: Reina is 34 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children. Reina catches and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for months. She has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase a second-hand pump boat to use for fishing. Reina has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Reina hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand pump boat to use for fishing.

loans.name: Murere Ole

texts.en:
Murere paid his previous loan well and in good time. He had a very good harvest since he used his loan so well by preparing his land for planting.

This is his third loan, which he plans to use to purchase farm inputs, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and also to buy animals for fattening. He intends to use the return from the loan to put back into farming and also to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and to buy animals for fattening.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married lady. She has five children who depend on her. She has been in farming for a period of six years.

She knew about KADET LTD through other women registered in her area of residence. This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She paid the previous loan successfully and without complication. She wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizer, and to hire manpower to aid in the farm. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizer, and to hire manpower.

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en:
Arvin works hard to support his family. Arvin is single and has a business selling used clothes in the Philippines.

Arvin requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell.

Arvin has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Arvin would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 49 years old and married with one child. Delia works very hard to provide for the family.

Delia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 27,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, cream, soap, oil, and spices. 

In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en:
Kakha is a 37-year-old farmer from the village of Karaleti in the Kartli region of East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family, which includes his wife, Shorena, two daughters (17 and 10 years old), and his mother-in-law. Both of the children go to school. 

All of the adult family members are involved in the family's farming activities, which are the primary source of income for them. In particular, the family owns a dairy cow and sells on average 20 kilograms of cheese per month. In addition, they grow garlic, cabbage, and tomatoes on their family-owned one hectare of land. The total average income of the family is 800 laris (about 480 USD) per month. 

Kakha requested a loan to purchase seeds for garlic. He will purchase quality seeds and count on a good harvest in the summer. After selling the harvest, he will get income, which will be used for the well-being of the family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for garlic

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is widowed with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elena is 56 years old and has two children in school.

Elena has a spice and vegetable retail business in the Philippines. Elena requested a 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of spices and vegetables to sell.

Elena has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline has been running a greenhouse, planting different kinds of fruits for the past six years and earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is 44 years old and married with four children who are still schooling. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by the KADET staff. She applied for her first loan, which she plans to use to buy tomato and green pepper seeds for the green house  farming 

Evaline hopes to make a profit and reinvest in other businesses that can generate more income. Her dream is to see her children prosper in life. She is a hardworking woman who can do better if funded.

loans.use: to buy tomato and green pepper seeds for the green house  farming

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Helen has been in this business for four years. Helen earns more income from farming rice.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Raga

texts.en:
Raga is married and has four children. She is 42 years old and resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Raga operates a business venture in fish-selling in her barangay (village) to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to purchase new equipment and tools.

Raga has been a member of GDMPC for nearly one year. Raga's plan is to finish the studies of her children and to gain double income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 37 years old and married with one child.

Melba works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Melba has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 11 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and from motorcycle transport.

Melba aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 53 years old. She is a widow with four children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Merlinda has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 25 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Merlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is 49 years and married.

Benilda is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Benilda requested a 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase pesticides and other farm supplies for her business.

Benilda has been farming rice for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Benilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and other farm supplies for her business.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 42 years old and married with six children.

Carolina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari sari store.

Carolina has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for five years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.

Carolina aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines.

Maria requested a loan of 17,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

Maria has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en: Marcelino is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. Marcelino has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marcelino hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old and married with 2 children. Mary works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 8 years and also earns an income from charcoal retail and raising pigs.

Mary aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is married with 6 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Meriam is 37 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Meriam requested a PHP 14,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment.

Meriam has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Meriam would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 53 years old and married with 9 children. With 4 children in school, Merlie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari sari store.

Merlie has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, spices, canned goods, etc. In the future Merlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 41 years old and has 7 children. She is married and has 4 children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Sylvia requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Sylvia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Josefina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Josefina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 46 years old and married with 4 children. With 2 children in school, Anecita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, biscuits, spices, beans, etc.. 

In the future Anecita would like to save enough to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is 44 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retailing business for 16 years and also earns an income from farming rice. Generosa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. Damiana has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Damiana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her store.

Milagros has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from the retail selling of feeds.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Muterian

texts.en:
Muterian is 46 years old and is married with five children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past 15 years.

He has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals. He has been a good client. He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm.

Muterian hopes to make a profit and use it to re-invest in other businesses. He is a persevering man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 35 years old and married with 2 children. With 2 children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Betty runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari sari (variety) store. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, sardines, spices, etc. 

In the future Betty would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 32 years old and married. She lives in Tukura, Zamboanga del Sur, with her two children. Elsie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has had this business for more than three years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional products to sell. Elsie has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. Elsie wishes to gain more income and to expand her business as well as to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 50 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Leonila aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Marilou has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & green bananas. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & bananas. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & bananas.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Connie has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old. She is married and has four school-going children. To make a living, she does mixed farming. She has been engaged in her farming for over eight years and earns approximately KES 5,000 a month for this activity. 

She has been a good client and this is her second loan which she plans to use to buy farm supplies including fertilizers and seeds. 


She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Most Cambodian people who live in the countryside prefer to do farming for their livelihoods. One among them is Mrs. Sreng, who is 47 years old and the mother of 5 children. She has been engaged in this business with her husband since 1993 in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh. Together, they typically earn an average of $4.00 per day and work hard to support the family. 

During this season, Sreng is taking care of her rice crops that are growing. She has to take out small plants that are not useful and keep the level of water in the rice field in good condition. However, there are many insects increased that always come to damage her crops. Sreng is applying for a loan to buy insecticides to protect her crops. 

With the rest of this fund, she’ll buy some fishing supplies that can be used to catch fish, crabs, and other creatures from the water for daily food. This loan will help support some part of her living.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and some fishing supplies.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Riza is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Riza has a used clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell.

Riza has been in this business for 10 years. Riza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sokoroti

texts.en:
Sokoroti has been practicing farming in Narok for the last seven years. He is 31 years old, single and supports his parents.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.


In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer and be rich.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as wheat seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Nchue

texts.en:
Nchue is 36 years old and married. He supports the seven people in his family. For the past six years Nchue has been a farmer. 

Nchue is requesting his third loan from KADET to buy maize seed and fertilizer and to hire temporary field workers to assist him with planting. He has been a good client and has repaid his previous loans well. In the future, Nchue hopes to see his children prosper.

loans.use: to buy maize seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Filiz

texts.en:
Filiz is the youngest of five children. Her mother and father were both tailors and her father passed away at a young age. All of her siblings learned how to sew from their mother and have been able to help support their family. Now, her siblings are all married, but Filiz is single and lives at home with her mother, who is retired. Filiz is a high school graduate and has 10 years of work experience, including working as an accountant, a car painter, and a tailor. 

Filiz decided to start her own business and has found a niche as a costume tailor. This will be her third loan with Maya after beginning three years ago. During that time, Filiz has: tripled her customers; doubled her production volume; increased her annual revenue by 50% in her second year; rented a workshop and employed her sister; set up a website and increased her internet sales; maintained high quality customer service and satisfaction; and designed and made theater costumes. 

With credit from Maya, Filiz wants to develop her business. Her loan will enable her to buy more sewing and embroidery machines that are necessary for her business. She will be able to produce a variety of regional costumes and other kinds of products to meet customer needs and demands. Filiz recently found a new work space and is aiming is to increase her production speed and grow her business.

In the future, Filiz wants to set up a large production shop with products of modern designs. She plans to get a space in the market to be better able to follow brands, prices and developments in the industry abroad in order to eventually sell products under her own brand name and her products abroad.

Filiz has many qualities that have enabled her success thus far. She was easily able to analyze the business sector, find a niche in costume production, and she seems predisposed to trade. She is brave, talented, and not afraid to experiment. 


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff


Filiz beş kardeşten en küçüğüydü.  Annesi ve babası terzilik yapıyordu.  Babası genç yaşta öldü.  Tüm kardeşleri annesinden nasıl dikiş dikileceğini öğrendi ve ailesinin geçimine katkıda bulundu.  Şimdi bütün kardeşleri evli fakat Filiz bekar ve emekli olan annesi ile birlikte yaşıyor.  Liseyi bitirdi ve on yıllık iş tecrübesi var.  Muhasebeci,araba boyacısı ve terzilik işlerinde çalıştı.  Kendi işini yapmaya ve uygun bir yer bulup kostüm sektörüne girmeye karar verdi.  Maya ile çalışmaya üç yıl evvel başladı ve bu onun üçüncü kredisi.  İşe başladığından bu zamana kadar:

     Müşteri kapasitesini üç katına çıkardı
     Üretim hacmini ikiye katladı.
     Yıllık ciro artışını iki yılda % 50 ye çıkardı.
     İşyeri kurma aşamasına geçti,personel çalıştırmaya başladı.
     Bunun için reklam ve tanıtım yaparak internet yoluyla satışa başladı.
     Kostüm kiralama ile ürün sayısını ve çeşitliliğini arttırdı.
     Makine ve malzeme alımı yaptı.
     Kaliteli hizmetle müşteri memnuniyetini korudu.
     Tiyatro kostümlerini tasarladı ve yaptı. 

Filiz Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile işini geliştirmek istiyor.  Kostüm sektöründe gerekli olan dikiş ve nakış makineleri alacak.  Böylece yöresel ve diğer çeşitli kostümlerinde üretimini sağlayarak, müşteri ihtiyaç ve taleplerini karşılamış olacak.  Son zamanlarda yeni çalışma yeri buldu ve ürünlerini daha hızlı dikerek, ürünlerini geliştirdi. Kendi işinin sahibi olmakla birlikte, büyük bir üretim atölyesi kurup, yeni ve modern ürünler tasarlamak istiyor.
Kendi işinin sahibi olmakla birlikte büyük bir üretim atölyesi kurup yeni ve modern ürünler tasarlamak istiyor.  Pazarda yerini alıp kendi markasıyla yurt dışına ürün pazarlamayı hedefliyor. Filiz Hanım'ın birçok ayırt edici özelliği olduğundan başarılı.Bu sektörü iyi analiz ettiğinden,kostüm sektöründe kendine yer edindi ve ticarete yatkın görünüyor.
Filiz Hanım,cesur ,yeniliklere açık ve yetenekli bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy sewing and embroidery machines

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia is 57 years old and married with six children. She is from Katipunan, Sinacaban Misamis Occidental. For the past 16 years, Anatalia has owned and operated a general store where she sells a variety of products to earn a living. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP. Anatalia has been a member of GDMPC for more than four years.

Anatalia is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to purchase more products to sell. In the future, she wants to improve her credit and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Brayson

texts.en:
Brayson is 29 years old, married, and he supports three people in his family. For the past five years, he has been a farmer. Brayson is a good KADET LTD client and was introduced to the organization by a staff member. 

Brayson is requesting a loan to buy maize seed and fertilizer and to hire temporary field workers to assist him to plant. In the future, he hopes to see his children prosper.

loans.use: to buy maize seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Gandaria 1 Group

texts.en:
Rohayati is 44 years old and married with three children.  For the past three years, she has been selling kitchen equipment  from her bicycle around her neighborhood.  Her business has been doing well and the income helps send her children to school. She will use this loan to buy more equipment such as frying pans, cooking spoons, and graters to resell to her customers.  

She hopes that someday she will have enough money to buy a stall for her business so she does not have to travel by bicycle.  She also hopes that her children will be able to stay in school and get a good education because she only completed elementary school.

loans.use: to pay for frying pans, cooking spoons, graters and other kitchen tools to resell.

loans.name: Ntetia

texts.en:
Ntetia is a very hard-working woman who practices mixed farming in Olokurto-Narok, Kenya. She has been in this business for over five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. 

She is 34 years old and married to Jackson, also a farmer. They have two children.

She is applying for her first loan. She plans to use part of the loan to buy farm inputs and other items to use in business. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena, 44, a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arnulfo, a baker, and mother to their four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lorena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Lorena earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. Aside from the variety store, she also manages their bakery.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. Part of the loan will be used to buy flour, oil and sugar as well. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Lorena. hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwangi

texts.en:
Mwangi, 40 years old, is married and has three children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years. 

He applied for his second loan from  KADET Ltd., which he will use to buy farm inputs (wheat seeds and also land preparation). 

With the profits generated he plans to pay school fees for his children.

He dreams of being a prominent farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more, notwithstanding limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Teresa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Teresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Teresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 51, a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ponciano, a security guard, and the mother of their five children, two of whom are working while the others are still studying in grade school. 

Lolita is working hard to put her children through college because, like many Filipino parents, she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can give their children.

Lolita makes a living by selling ornamental plants. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and a variety of hanging plants and others. She’s been 11 years in this business. Aside from this she also earns from the rentals of rooms in her place. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the community. And she earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of PHP 14,000. She will be using the money to buy things needed for planting such as fertilizer, pots, seedlings. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Lolita hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.ru: Курбон житель района Джиликул. Ему 57 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его дети учатся в России. Сам он занимается выращиванием овощей для торговли. Кроме того у него имеется сад фруктовых деревьев. Он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Kurbon lives in the Jilikul region. He is 57 years old. He is married and has two children. His children study in Russia.  Kurbon grows vegetables for sale. In addition, he has a fruit orchard. He is taking out a loan in order to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Mrs. Hai is a married woman who is a resident of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She earns a living by cultivating rice crops alongside her husband on their existing farmland. This couple has five children. Four of them are living with them, while the other one is married and lives away. 

Hai always spends most of her time for useful activities like doing the farming, providing food and other services for the family as well as raising some piglets behind her house. She has tried hard to provide her children a healthy life and a comfortable living. The coming rainfall is a signal for her to start cultivating her rice crops. 

Hai would like to request some funds from HKL, one of Kiva’s partners, to purchase rice seeds, mineral fertilizers and some piglets for raising. In future, Hai plans to build a bigger piggery and raise as many pigs as she can.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, mineral fertilizers and some piglets for raising.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize seeds for planting.

loans.name: Bumuutsogzol

texts.en:
Bumuutsogzol is a 39-year-old widow who lives with her two sons and one daughter in an outer 'ger' district (a district without basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her elder son and daughter attend local university, while her other son attends secondary school. 

Bumuutsogzol has supported her family by operating a clothing retail stall business at the largest outdoor market in of Mongolia for eleven years. When she first began her business, she had one million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) in working capital. Now she has 6 million MNT in working capital. She sells jeans and trousers, which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China, twice a month. 

She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase jeans and trousers for the upcoming season. “Sometimes it’s really hard to support the family alone, but it’s my responsibility, therefore I must to do that,” Bumuutsogzol says.

loans.use: to purchase more jeans for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Jeruk Manis 1 Group

texts.en:
Karniawati is 32 years old and married with three children.  She has been buying and reselling snacks (cakes and cookies) and clothing from her home since 2007.  This is her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia.  Her business is going smoothly. She wants the loan to increase her business capital (for snacks and clothing to resell) and will also use some for school fees for the children. 

The income from her business also helps pay for the school fees and uniforms so the family can send their children to school.  She hopes that the family continues to have enough income so the business can grow and the family can be more prosperous.  Also, if they become more prosperous, they hope they can someday afford to send their children to college.

loans.use: to buy more snacks (cakes and cookies) and clothing to resell.

loans.name: Makimbilio Group

texts.fr: Apendeki est conseillère dans le groupe de crédit MAKIMBILIO, cliente au 6eme cycle de crédit , âgée de 60 ans , mariée , mère de cinq enfants dont 2 vont a l’école et 3 sont déjà mariée. Elle vend la bière et les sucrées à son domicile au quartier mikeno, avenue du 20 mai. Avec le crédit de l’IMF HEKIMA, elle compte accroitre son chiffre d’affaires en achetant 30 caisses de bière primus ,4 caisse de biere Mutzing et 15 caisses de sucrées. Elle remercie l’IMF HEKIMA pour les crédits qu’elle reçoit sans garantie matérielle car grâce a ces crédits, elle a déjà acheté une parcelle et elle compte la construire.
texts.en: Apendeki is the advisor of the MAKIMBILIO community bank.  She is taking part in her sixth loan cycle.  Apendeki is 60 years old, married, and has five children.  Two of her children attend school and three are already married.  She sells beer and soda from her home in Mikeno neighborhood, Avenue du 20 mai.  Apendeki plans to use her loan from the MFI HEKIMA to increase her business by purchasing 30 crates of Primus beer, 4 crates of Mutzing beer and 15 crates of soda.  She thanks HEKIMA for the loans that she receives without the need for collateral because, thanks to these loans, she has already bought a plot of land on which she plans to build.

loans.use: to buy 34 crates of beer and 15 cases of soda

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent has been a farmer for the last three years. He is 27 years old, married, and a father of one child.

He learned about KADET Ltd. from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. This is his first loan and he planned to spend it to purchase farm supplies such as maize seeds and fertilizer and also to hire casual workers to aid in the farm. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dreams are to be the best and most well known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 32 years old and is married to a businessman. She adopted one child who is currently in school. She sells shoes and handbags in a store she has been running for 10 years. 

Epiphanie would like a loan to increase her inventory. The profits will be used to pay school fees for her child and to create savings for her future. She would like to see her business prosper in the future

loans.use: To buy more shoes and handbags for sale.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 49 years old and is a widow with five children age 9 to 25. All of them are currently in school. 

She sells used clothes in a store she has been running for 15 years. 

Jeanette would like a loan to increase her inventory of used clothes. She will use any profits to pay school fees for her children and create a savings for her future. 

She would eventually like to become a wholesaler of used clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Elsadai Group

texts.en:
Surta is 46 years old and married with four children ages 14 to 19. The children are all still going to school.    Her husband works as a laborer and a driver.  She has been selling second-hand clothes to her neighbors and friends for six years from her house.  The business continues to grow.  She enjoys having the supplemental income to add to her husband's but sometimes finds it challenging to find good second-hand clothing.  Someday she'd like to become an agent/distributor and sell clothing to shops.  She also hopes that all of her children can attend college and that she and her husband can afford to pay for it.

The other group members will use their loans for their businesses including a general store, selling oil/lubricants for vehicle engines, and reselling clothing.

loans.use: to pay for more used clothing to resell from her house.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julliene is 59 years old and has six children age 18 to 31. All of her children went to school. She is a widow. 

She sells clothes and bed sheets in a store she has been running for eight years. 

Julienne would like a loan to buy more clothes and bed sheets to sell. She would like to use the profits to continue to support her children and their education.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en:
Marie is 32 years old with four children between the ages of 3 and 12. Three are currently in school. She is married to a man who is a moto taxi driver.  

She has been running a store for 10 years where she sells different goods and recharges batteries.  

She would like to use the loan to buy more utensils to sell. She would like to use the profits of her business to create savings for her future and build a house for her family. She is looking forward to seeing her business prosper.

loans.use: To buy more utensils for resale.

loans.name: Batkhuu

texts.en:
Batkhuu is a 42-year-old widow who lives with her son and daughter, ages 23 and 24, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a small house in the outer 'ger'  district (a district without basic infrastructure). Batkhuu’s son is a web designer and her daughter works as a teacher at a local public school. Batkhuu supports her family by operating a retail clothing stall at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

When she first began her business in 2003, Batkhuu had 800,000 MNT in working capital. Today, her business has grown and she has about 4,000,000 MNT in working capital. Batkhuu sells jeans and trousers. “I want to grow my business more with this loan and I would like to be able to buy my own apartment in future and live there with my family,” she says. Batkhuu is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to increase the variety of jeans and trousers she sells.

loans.use: to purchase jeans and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 37 years old. He has owned a hardware store for more than six years. He has four children who are aged between one and 17. He wants the loan to increase his inventory and expand his business. His wife is a businesswoman selling clothes. The profits from the business will be used to expand and renovate his house. He wishes to have his own business venue in the future.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is married to a plumber. They have five children in the range of 2 and 11 and their children go to school. Therese is 39 years old. She sells clothes and shoes. She has spent more than 16 years in the business. Therese requested the loan to buy more shoes and clothes for resale.  The profits will be used for paying school fees and increasing her inventory. She would like to become a sole wholesaler in the future

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a very hard-working woman who has practiced mixed farming for over five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. She is 44 years old and married to Paul who is  also a farmer; they have five children.

She is applying for her first loan after being introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is a registered client. She plans to use the part of the loan amount to buy farm inputs and the rest for a business. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay  school fees for her children. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Nirvana Group

texts.en:
Bariyah is 31 years old and married with two children.   Her children are 13 and 10 years old.   Her husband is a laborer working on construction projects.  She has been selling items such as coffee, instant noodles, cooked eggs, and pop-ice from her stall for the past two years. She will use this loan to replenish the stock of food and coffee to sell and also to buy gas for her stove to cook noodles and eggs for her customers.  Her business is going well and she can use the income to give money to her children to ride the public van to school.  She also enjoys her business because the supplemental income added to her husband's helps cover the daily expenses of the family. As Bariyah only completed elementary school, she wants to be able to send her children to have better and more education than she had.  

The other group members will use their loans for businesses such as selling used hand phones and selling clothing to customers on credit.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, instant noodles, eggs, and pop-ice to sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
This is Charlita, 47, a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Raul, an instructor, and they have six children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Charlita operates a salon business. She offers hair styling, hair grooming, manicure, pedicure, and the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 21,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for her salon like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Charlita hopes her business will continue over the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for salon materials and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en: Enkhtsetseg is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase a large number of winter clothes for increasing her business sales.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is married and has five children, three of whom attend school.  She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for 12 years.  

Valentine is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more beans, bananas, and cassava flour to sell. The profits from this business will be saved so that Valentine can build her own house. In the future, she would like to have a motorbike as another source of income

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Anastasi

texts.en:
Anastasi is a 38-year-old lady who is married to Elias, a 43-year-old man. They are blessed with six children namely: Gaudesiana, 16, studying at the 2nd grade of Senior High School; Cristianis, 14, studying at the 3rd grade of Junior High School; Ludgardis, 10, Maria, 8; and Sisco, 7, all of them are attending Primary School, and Secilia, 2.

Anastasi operates a kiosk business which sells daily needs such fresh vegetables, kerosene, detergents, eggs, bread, coffee, sugar, tea, gasoline etc. Anastasi is grateful that the business benefits her family. She is able to pay the children's education fees through her business income.

Anastasi plans to sell instant cold beverages and soft drinks as demanded by the customers. She thinks that this is a good business and profitable as they are living in a tropical region. Unfortunately, she does not have money to buy a refrigerator. Therefore, Anastasi is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM; she would like to purchase a refrigerator and to add more stock before Christmas. She really hopes that TLM will approve her loan application.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and to add more stock.

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui, 52, lives with her children, both of whom attend high school, and her husband in the boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For the past six months Negui has been selling children's clothes in a market called “Sunday,” and already has gained some permanent customers.

She and her husband also own a small piece of land upon which she has been planting vegetables since last June. Because the land has produced a good yield, Negui is now requesting a loan of MNT 3.000.000 to purchase more nearby land in order to expand her agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of farmland.

loans.name: Chagnaadorj

texts.en:
Chagnaadorj is 32 years old and has two children, one of whom attends school.  He is a vendor in a private company, which he has been doing for two years. However, his salary is not enough for his family's necessities and expenses, so he is trying to start a new business providing  transportation around the city. 

Chagnaadorj is requesting a loan to purchase a minivan for his new transportation business. According to this plan, the new business will increase his earnings in the future.

loans.use: to cover the payment of his new minivan.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en: Jean Bosco is 39 years old, married and has three children, only one of whom goes to school. Jean Bosco, who has been selling fish for eight years, has requested this loan to buy more fish to sell. He wishes to use the new profits to reinvest in the business so that he can become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Enkhtuya is a 31-year-old widow who lives with her son and parents in a local dormitory, located in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her son attends secondary school, while both of Enkhtuya’s parents work at a cashmere company. 

In 2009 Enkhtuya began a business selling jeans and trousers. She started with one million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) in working capital. Since then, her business has grown, and today she has approximately 3.7 million MNT in working capital. She is requesting a 1.5 million MNT loan to purchase additional jeans for the upcoming season. In the future, she wants to expand her business and increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase jeans for upcoming season

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is a 46-year-old widow. She has three children between the ages of 18 and 22 years.

Immaculee sells clothes and has been in this business for five years. She needs the loan to add more clothes to her store. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees and provide food for her family. In the future, Immaculee hopes to see her business generating more profits.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Munkhtsetseg, 32, retails vegetables in a food market. She lives with her two daughters and her husband in Kherlen, a town on the western boundary of Mongolia. 

She has been running her business since 2009. During past years her business earnings were not so bad. Now she is planning to start her second new business, sales of casual clothes. First she needs to create business working capital so she can make sales. 

The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing some casual clothes in bulk from suppliers and to rent a stall in the bazaar.

loans.use: to purchase some casual clothes in bulk from suppliers and to rent a stall in the bazaar.

loans.name: Ireti Group

texts.fr: IRETI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres cohabitent ensemble. La représentante du groupe Sabine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un agent de sécurité  du nom de Hiller. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sabine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison Sabine n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis six ans Sabine vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sabine vend des cotons et des pâtes dentifrice. Sabine achète ses produits au Bénin et au Nigéria. C’est la première  fois que  Sabine et les autres membres du groupe IRETI sollicitent l’appui financier de  ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The IRETI group consists of three people who live side-by-side.  Sabine (whose hand is raised in the photo) is the group’s representative.  She is 39 years old and is married to Hiller, a security officer.  Sabine lives together with her husband and children.  The couple takes care of the various household expenses.  Sabine didn’t go to school.  She has been selling prepaid phone cards for six years.  She also sells cotton and toothpaste.  Sabine buys these products in Benin and Nigeria.  This is the first time that Sabine and the other members of the IRETI group have requested financial assistance from ALIDé.  They want to bolster their working capital and their businesses so as to better respond to customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase prepaid phone cards

loans.name: Miwononvi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIWONONVI  est formé de deux personnes qui cohabitent au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Mariam, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Mariam est âgée de 36 ans et est  marié à un frigoriste du nom de Marcel. Mariam a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux restent encore à sa charge. Mariam vit avec son mari et ses enfants. le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges. Mariam a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Depuis cinq ans, Mariam exerce comme activité, la fabrication de pure water par le système de livraison à domicile, et de façon secondaire, la  vente de l’eau de pompe. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Mariam désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Mariam sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIWONONVI, un quatrième crédit auprès de  ALIDé.
texts.en: The Miwononvi group is made up of two people who both live in Bénin.  The representative of the group, named Mariam, has her hand raised in the photo. This is the fourth time that this group has requested financial help through ALIDé in order to grow their business.  Mariam is 36 years old and is married to a refrigeration specialist name Marcel.  Mariam has four children. All have been educated and two are still in her care.  Mariam lives with her husband and children.  Together, the couple meets their different needs.  Mariam left school at the primary level. She has been making and delivering pure water to people’s homes for five years.  She also sells water from the pump.  This allows her to meet the needs of her family without too much difficulty.  In order to meet the demands of her customers, Mariam wants to increase her stock of products and to raise the level of her business.  To do this, Mariam is requesting, along with the other member of the Miwononvi group, a fourth loan through ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy containers for pure water.

loans.name: Yostantina

texts.en:
Yostantina is a 27-year-old single lady who is running a beauty salon business. She lives separately from her parents after graduating from Senior High School.

Yostantina has been running her business for the past four years. She spent her savings to start up the business. Yostantina is grateful for the support of her parents through the provision of business capital assistance. She bought beauty equipment and hires a small room to operate the business in. 

At her beauty salon Yostantina does hair cuts, hair cream bath, hair smoothing, streamlining etc. She operates the business from 8 am to 9 pm. Since she has a lot of customers, Yostantina employs two assistants to help her.

Yostantina wishes to offer other services such as facials, masks and brides' make-up but unfortunately she does not have enough capital to do so. This problem led her to seek a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. She would like to buy beauty products such as facial products, make-up masks, vitamins and cosmetic products for brides' make-up to use in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such facial products, make-up masks, vitamins and cosmetic products for brides' make-up.

loans.name: Daya-To Group

texts.fr: DAYA-TO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Akouavi Pélagie(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un technicien en génie civil nommé Fataï. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Akouavi Pélagie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Akouavi Pélagie a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis six ans Akouavi Pélagie vend des tissus et des chaussures, activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables dans son quartier. Akouavi Pélagie achète ses produits au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Akouavi Pélagie et les autres membres du groupe DAYA-TO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
DAYA-TO is a group of three people whose members live together. The representative of the group, Akouavi Pélagie (whose hand is raised in the photograph), is 39 years old and married to a civil engineer named Fataï. Akouavi Pélagie and Fataï live together with their two children who are both in school and dependent on their parents. Together, the couple manages the various household expenses. 

Akouavi Pélagie stopped her education in secondary school. For the past six years, she has sold fabric and shoes, a business that she maintains and that brings her significant income in her neighborhood. Akouavi Pélagie buys her products in Togo, the country next to Benin. This is the fourth time that she and the other members of the group DAYA-TO have sought financial support from ALIDÉ in order to build their working capital and their businesses, and to better respond to the needs of their customers.

loans.use: To buy fabric and shoes.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 54 года. Женат. У него шестеро детей. Трое его детей находятся в России. Сам Шерали при доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 40 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Sherali lives in the Jilikul district.  He is 54 years old, married and has six children.  Three of his children are in Russia.  Sherali has a plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables.  He has been involved in this type of business for 40 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson, 31, is married and has two children. He does mixed farming: i.e. rearing sheep and goats, and also is a wheat farmer, which he has been doing for the past seven years.

He learned about KADET LTD through a KADET staff member. He paid his first loan successfully and applied for a second loan, which he plans to spend partially on farming and the remainder on purchasing more animals.

He hopes to make a profit and use the anticipated profits to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to spend part on farming and the remainder on purchasing more animals.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is 52 years old and lives with her husband, daughter, and granddaughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is a retired old man who babysits his granddaughter.  Altantsetseg’s daughter helps her with the business. 

Altantsetseg started her food delivery business after she retired from a shoe factory in 2009. She delivers her own homemade food and is well-recognized in the market. 

She has a bright vision to open a restaurant one day. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I am happy when people enjoy my food." She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy some kitchen electronics to make food.

loans.use: to buy some kitchen electronics.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 33, is married and supports seven people in his family. He has been in farming for the past four years. 

He is a humble client. He knew of KADET LTD through other clients registered in the area where he lives.This will be his first loan from KADET LTD and he intends to use the loan to prepare the land for farming and purchase maize seeds.

Stephen plans to reinvest back into the farm the anticipated profit generated. He dreams of being a big farmer. He can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to prepare the land for farming.

loans.name: Karel

texts.en:
Karel is a 37-year-old single man and is living with his parents. As the oldest son, he is responsible for supporting his family since his parents are getting older.
 
Karel works as a farmer as his father did for many years. Based on the skills that he learnt from his father, Karel continues the business by planting vegetables such as tomatoes, water spinach and corn. The agricultural products produced from his farm will be sold in the market. 

The challenge for Karel of being a farmer is the climate as the harvest depends on climate. Sometimes he cannot fully cover his needs as well as the household needs due to few crops generated. 

Karel is dreaming of hiring a plot of land which belongs to his neighbor. He wants to cultivate tomatoes, chili peppers, eggplant, etc. He thinks that the more vegetable he cultivates, the more income he will earn. That is the reason why Karel is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. He plans to use the loan to purchase more seeds, pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds, pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Duterimbere/kzr Group

texts.fr:
Zachée fait partie du groupe Duterimbere/Kzr. Le nom du groupe signifie « avançons en avant». Il a 38 ans et il est marié avec 5 enfants de 3 à 12 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  6 ans de primaire.

Zachée est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences de la race améliore du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Zachée voudrait agrandir la surface de culture du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigne ses enfants.
texts.en:
Zachée is part of the group Duterimbere/Kzr. The name means something like "forging ahead with progress". He is 38 years old, married and has 5 children between the ages of 3 and 12, 3 are in school. He finished 6 years of elementary school.

He is a rice farmer. This is his first round of financing with ACB. He is going to use the loan to purchase chemical fertilizers for his rice crops.

His strategy for business growth is to use the best type of rice seeds. In the next few years, he would like to increase his arable land for growing rice. With his profits, he intends to educate and take care of his children.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizer for his rice crops

loans.name: Iddi

texts.ru: Идди проживает в районе Варзоб. Он женат. Ему 48 лет. У него четверо детей. Он имеет средне - специальное образование, плотник. Он арендует помещение, где занимается изготовлением деревянных дверей и окон. Этим видом деятельности он занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для приобретения досок.
texts.en: Iddi lives in the Varzob district.  He is 48 years old, married and has four children.  He has a secondary-specialized education and is a carpenter.  Iddi leases a space, where he makes wood doors and windows.  He has been involved in this business for six years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of wood planks.

loans.use: to purchase wood planks

loans.name: Bubutay

texts.ru: Бубутай  - 66 лет пенсионерка, вдова. Она долгое время работала швеей, а сейчас занимается пошивом национальных изделий, пользующихся высоким спросом среди местного населения.   Бубутай является матерью 7 детей и бабушкой 21 внука. В поисках источника финансирования, в 1995 году ее семья  начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Бубутай, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется две  дойные коровы, один теленок,  три рабочие лошади и надел земли с картофелем и пшеницей.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бубутай обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Часть доходов от кредита Бубутай вложит в откорм скота, часть – в ремонт дома.
texts.en: Bubutay is a 66-year-old pensioner and a window.
